entries.name: Male Names
entries: Chisnaon, Chranibos, Hodnaumas, Hosus, Huxhess, Krusakshez, Kunagos, Oses, Phonytion, Sthudis, Vadronos, Vothonos

entries.name: Female Names
entries: Avita, Crishaa, Hugge, Khatta, Kyrero, Lashnishtra, Mencarea, Nagini, Nidratta, Pholea, Rorora, Zosda

feat.name: Divination Initiate
entries: Your study of divination magic allows you to see just a glimpse into the future.

When you finish a long rest, roll one {@dice d20} and record the number. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with this foretelling roll. You must choose to do so before the roll. This foretelling roll can only be used once. When you finish a long rest, you lose your unused foretelling roll.

feat.name: Finesse Grappler
entries: Your nimbleness gives you an advantage in battle even against enemies physically superior. You gain the following benefits:

items: You can make a Dexterity (Acrobatics) check instead of a Strength (Athletics) check to grapple someone.
When you have a creature grappled, you can attempt to shove it prone as a bonus action.

feat.name: Gambler
entries: Playing with luck is your specialty, you gain the following benefits:

items: Increase your Charisma or Intelligence score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain proficiency with two types of {@item gaming set} of your choice.
You have advantage on Deception (Charisma) checks to bluff opponents in games of chance and History (Intelligence) checks to count cards.

When an enemy targets you with a weapon attack but before it rolls to hit, you may use your reaction to lower your AC to 11 for the duration of the attack. If the attack misses you, you may make a weapon attack against the target if it is within range, dealing an additional amount of damage on a successful hit equal to the amount you reduced your AC.

feat.name: Ghost
entries: Through training or lack of presence, you are skilled at hiding away from the idle eye. You gain the following benefits:

items: Creatures engaged in conversation have disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to notice you.
You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when you remain still.
When you roll initiative, you can immediately take the Hide action for free. You regain the ability to do so after a short rest.

feat.name: Journeyman Conductor
entries: You have spent some time in the bardic teachings of a maestro. granting you minor command over the music of combat. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn 2 {@filter Conducting Techniques|optionalfeatures|feature type=Conducting Techniques} of your choice from among those available to the College of the Maestro in the bard class. If a technique you use requires your target to make a saving throw to resist the technique's effects, the saving throw DC equals 8 + proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier.
If you already have Bardic Inspiration dice, you gain one more: otherwise, you have one Bardic Inspiration die which is a {@dice d6}.

entries: This die can be given to others as a bonus action (as per the Bardic Inspiration bard feature), or can be used to fuel your techniques. A Bardic Inspiration die is expended when you use it. You regain this expended bardic inspiration die when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Knife Master
entries: You only need the smallest of blades to deal crippling wounds, and you are skilled at making sudden, rapid strikes when an opportunity is presented. You gain the following features:

items: When you deal a critical hit with a dagger or sickle, you roll {@dice 1d6} and add the result to the damage rolled for the attack.
You can use daggers to attempt to pick locks, adding your proficiency bonus to related checks.
You gain advantage on any Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks to conceal a dagger or sickle on your person.

feat.name: Larger Than Life
entries: Despite your humble size, you are a force to be reckoned with. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You ignore the heavy property for weapons you are proficient with.
You count as one size larger when determining whom you can grapple or shove.
Your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift is one and a half times its normal value.

feat.name: Stone Headed
entries: Lack of mental capability has turned into something good for you, and you gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You have advantage on saving throws made to resist enchantment spells.
You are immune to being {@condition charmed}.

feat.name: Whip Master
entries: You've learned how to use the out-of-the-ordinary properties of a whip to your advantage. Its versatile nature allows you to perform a variety of maneuvers. While wielding a whip you also gain the following benefits:

items: With the whip, you can manipulate objects such as switches, levers, chests, or doorknobs within 10 feet. If an object weighs fewer than 5 pounds, you can grab and deposit it into a free hand.

entries: In addition, when you take the Attack action and attack with only a whip, you can use a bonus action to use one of the following effects:

items: You can attempt to disarm or knock prone a creature within range. Make an attack roll with a -5 penalty contested by the target's Stength (Athletics) check or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (the target chooses the ability to use). You automatically fail the contest if the target is two or more size categories larger than you. If you win the contest, the attack causes no damage or other ill effect, but the defender either drops an item of your choice or is knocked prone (your choice).
You can make a single weapon attack with a whip against a creature within range.
You can use the Help action to aid an ally attacking an enemy within 10 feet of you.

feat.name: Advanced Psionics
entries: You've trained your mind to greatly improve your psionic capabilities. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell message|PHB} cantrip

You learn the {@spell catapult|xge} and {@spell enhance ability|phb} spells and can cast them once without expending a spell slot. You regain the ability to cast them again when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Aquan Magic
entries: You are more attuned to the magic of the Elemental Plane of Water than others of your kind. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma modifier increases by 1.
You learn the {@spell shape water|xge} cantrip.

You learn the {@spell ice knife|xge} spell, and may cast it at second level once without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Arcane Plagiarist
entries: You have learned to mimic the magical abilities of others. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
You learn the {@spell minor illusion|PHB} cantrip.

You learn the {@spell silent image|PHB} spell and may cast it once at first level without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Athletic Perfection
entries: The time spent competing with your peers has helped to shape your body to a near perfect state. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency in Stealth, Acrobatics or Sleight of Hand.
You have advantage on Athletics checks made to throw objects or small creatures.

feat.name: Auran Spirit
entries: You have learned spent time learning from your elders, preparing to tend to the spiritual need of your tribe. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell guidance|PHB} and {@spell gust|xge} cantrips.

You learn the {@spell augury|PHB} or the {@find familiar|PHB} spell. You can cast the spell you choose as a ritual. (If you choose the find familiar spell, unless you gain it from another source, you can only conjure a creature with a flying speed).

feat.name: Blood of The Chameleon
entries: You are skilled at ambushing foes and prey, aided by modified scales. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency in Stealth.
Your scales can change hue to aid your ambushes. You can attempt to hide while only lightly obscured by foliage, snow, heavy rain and other natural effects.

feat.name: Blood of The Komodo
entries: You produce acidic saliva, which you can use to augment your attacks. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by 1.
You gain resistance to poison damage.

You secrete a dangerous venom. When you make a bite attack, you can choose to add an additional 1d6 acid damage. You can do this a number of times equal to your Constitution modifier, and you regain all uses after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Child Of The Current
entries: You were born in the water, and have learned to use it to increase your vitality. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength or Constitution score increases by 1.
You have advantage on Athletics checks while underwater.
If you spend an entire short rest submerged in water, you may treat a number of hit dice up to your Constitution modifier as having rolled their maximum.

feat.name: Divine Avatar
entries: You have learned to harness the divine energy within you to aid your allies, as well as smite your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by 1.

When you transform into your divine form using your Radiant Consumption, Radiant Soul or Necrotic Shroud feature, creatures of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you regain hit points equal to your level.

feat.name: Draconic Blessing
entries: Either you or your ancestors received a boon from a chromatic dragon, granting you a spark of their power. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma score increases by 1.

entries: Choose one of the following draconic bloodlines. You gain the benefits associated with it:

items.name: Black.
entries: You gain resistance to acid damage and learn the {@spell acid splash|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: Blue.
entries: You gain resistance to lightning damage and learn the {@spell shocking grasp|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: Green.
entries: You gain resistance to poison damage and learn the {@spell poison spray|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: Red.
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage and learn the {@spell produce flame|PHB} cantrip.

items.name: White.
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage and learn the {@spell ray of frost|PHB} cantrip.

feat.name: Emissary of The Air
entries: The quickness of wind guides your movements. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

In response to being hit with a weapon attack, you can use your reaction to transform your body into wind, instantly reappearing in an unoccupied space within 60 feet causing the attack to miss. You regain use of this ability after you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Expert Mimic
entries: You have spent so long copying others, it's second nature to you now. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency with two of the following: {@item thieves' tools|PHB}, {@item forgery kit|PHB} , {@item calligraphy' tools|PHB} or {@item painter' tools|PHB}

During a long rest, you can spend time observing a willing creature. From this, you can mimic their proficiency in a specific skill or tool, gaining proficiency in this skill until the start of your next long rest.

feat.name: Fey Spirit
entries: You are more in touch with the fickle magics of the Feywild than others of you kind, allowing you to alter your form. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma score increases by 1.
You can speak, read, and write {@language Sylvan}.

You learn the {@spell alter self|PHB} spell and can cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this feature once you complete a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell.

feat.name: Focused Radiance
entries: You have learned to focus the divine energy within your body, using it to cast spells. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom or Charisma score increases by 1.
You learn the  {@spell guidance|PHB} or  {@spell sacred flame|PHB} cantrip.

You learn the  {@spell bless|PHB} or  {@spell guiding bolt|PHB} spell, and may cast it once at second level without using a spell slot. You regain use of this ability when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Grasp of The Earth
entries: You use the power of the earth to impede your enemies. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength score increases by 1.

As an action, you can strike the ground, causing soil and rocks to leap up around another creature within 30 feet. This creature must make a Strength saving through (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier) or be take {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage and be {@condition restrained} for 1 minute. If this creature is within range, you may use a bonus action to make a melee weapon attack against it. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Guardian of The Waves
entries: You are attuned to the oceans and the deep places of the world, gracing you with powers. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

As an action, you give yourself a watery form that lasts for one round. While in this form, you can pass through another creature's space, however you cannot end your turn there. While in this form, you may also pass through gaps as small as 1 inch. You regain the use of this ability after you finish a short or long rest.

You can cast the {@spell speak with animals|PHB} spell at will, however unless you gain it from another source you can only speak with creatures that can breathe water, as well as dolphins and whales.

feat.name: Iron Will
entries: The Chaos of Limbo is truly violent, and you have trained your mind to resist it. You gain the following benefit:

items: You have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws against spells.

feat.name: Lazy Brute
entries: The sooner you get done dealing with your foes, the sooner you can go back to sleep. You gain the following benefits:

items: When you roll a critical hit on a melee weapon attack, you can roll one additional damage dice.
If you spend all of a short rest sleeping, you gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus + half your level (rounded down).

feat.name: Leader of The Pack
entries: You have a magnetic personality, and cats always seem to look to you for guidance. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Charisma score increases by 1.
You have advantage on Animal Handling checks made with feline creatures.
Once per long rest you may cast the  {@spell find familiar|PHB} spell as a ritual. Unless you gain this spell from another source, when you cast it this way you can only target a cat.

feat.name: Light on Your Feet
entries: No matter how you fall, you always seem to be able to twist and land on your feet. You gin the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency in Acrobatics.
You do not take damage from falling 20 feet or less. When you do take damage from falling, you may reduce the damage by an amount equal to half your level.

feat.name: Magic of The Grove
entries: There are few as attuned to the forest as you. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
You learn the  {@spell druidcraft|PHB} cantrip
You learn the {@spell pass without trace|PHB} spell, and may cast it once without expending a spell slot. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Make-do Attitude
entries: You've learned to survive and craft basic tools and weapons from only what you can scavenge. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Wisdom score increases by 1.
You gain proficiency with one of the following:  {@item woodcarver's tools|PHB}, {@item weaver's tools|PHB}, {@item herbalism kit|PHB}

During a short or long rest, provided you have access to an appropriate crafting material (ie. wood, vines, etc) you can make one of the following: a fishing pole, a club, a net, a blow gun or 10 blowgun darts. To do this you require appropriate tools (ie. Woodcarvers) or a dagger.

feat.name: Mountain's Blessing
entries: The markings that cover your body expand, indicating your blessing by a mountain spirit. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Intelligence or Wisdom score increases by one.
You gain proficiency in Religion

When you make a saving throw against a magical effect, you may choose to give yourself advantage on the roll. You can do this after you see the roll, but before you know the result. You regain use of this feature after you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Nest of Serpents
entries: You've studied the rituals of those in higher castes as they devote themselves to the serpent gods, and you've picked up a thing or two from them. You gain the following benefit:

items: As an action, you can transform a pile of sticks, ten arrows or small pieces of wood into a swarm of poisonous snakes. The swarm acts as your ally, and obeys your commands. This transformation lasts for one minute, after which the swarm reverts to its original form. If the swarm is killed before this, it reverts to normal early. You may do this once, and regain this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Primordial Constitution
entries: As a plane touched humanoid, your body is hardier than many others. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by one.
You gain resistance to cold and poison damage.
You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

feat.name: Promising Commander
entries: You performed endless training routines to amplify your tactical abilities in the timeless Astral Sea. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength score increases by one.
You learn one language of your choice.

As a bonus action, you let out a rallying war cry, ending the frightened or charmed condition on yourself and a number of allies that can hear you equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). You can use this ability once, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Protector Of Nature
entries: You have learned to use Fey charms to prevent others from tampering with the areas you protect. You gain the following benefits:

items: You gain proficiency in Persuasion. If you are already proficient, you can add double your proficiency bonus to your persuasion checks.

As an action, you can beguile those who would damage the natural world. Choose one creature within 30 feet of you. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw (DC 8 + proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or become charmed by you for 1 minute. A creature makes this saving throw with disadvantage if it has harmed a beast or plant in the past round. If the target takes any damage, it may repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. You can do this once, and regain the ability to do it again after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Savage Attacker
entries: When you hit someone, they had better stay down. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Strength score increases by one.

When you reduce a creature to zero hitpoints with a melee weapon attack, you can make another melee weapon attack as a bonus action. If this attack hits, it does additional damage equal to your Strength modifier.

feat.name: Shadow Magic
entries: In the lifetimes you have spent serving your shrouded queen, you have gained an affinity for magic that influences others. You gain the following benefits:

items: You learn the {@spell friends|PHB} cantrip.

You learn the {@spell charm person|PHB} and {@spell detect thoughts|PHB} spells and can cast each spell once without expending a spell slot. You regain the use of this feature once you finish a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

feat.name: Serpent Form
entries: You have unlocked more of your serpentfolk heritage. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Intelligence or Charisma score increases by 1.

You can use an action to polymorph into a Medium snake or back into your true form. Your statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment you are wearing or carrying isn't transformed. If you die, you stay in your current form.

While in snake form, you gain a bite attack as a natural weapon, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with it, you deal piercing damage equal to {@damage 1d4} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. When you hit with a bite attack, you can choose to deal {@damage 2d6} additional poison damage to the target. Once you deal this poison damage, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Strength of The Sea
entries: Your time deep beneath the waves has toughened your body. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Constitution score increases by one.
You gain resistance to cold and acid damage
You are resistant to the effects of extreme pressure.

feat.name: The Eternal Flame
entries: A flame burns within you, and you've learned how to harness it. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Intelligence score increases by one.

As an action, you surround yourself with a wreath of flames which lasts for one minute. While this is active, any creature that hits you with a melee attack from within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier.
Additionally, when you roll fire damage while this wreath is active, you may add your Constitution modifier to the damage rolled. You regain use of this ability after you finish a long rest.

feat.name: Trickster's Spirit
entries: You are accustomed to using others to avoid being attacked. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

When a creature you can see targets you with an attack and another creature is within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll. Once you use this ability, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Wings of Iron
entries: You have spent your formative years training with the wardens of your tribe. You gain the following benefits:

items: Your Dexterity score increases by one.
You gain proficiency with {@item spear}, {@item javelin} and {@item net}.
When you are flying and dive at least 30 feet towards a target and hit it with a melee weapon, you can cause the attack to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} damage of the weapons type to the target.

optionalfeature.name: Aria of Suspense (Ansla)
entries: You build an air of tension and paranoia with subtle, droning tones. As an action, you expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. For the next 10 minutes, any creatures of your choice within 60 feet cannot be surprised and gain a bonus to saving throws against traps and environmental hazards equal to your Bardic Inspiration die roll.

optionalfeature.name: Crash (Marcato)
entries: You learn how to harness and amplify the roar of a well-placed blow into a violent explosion of sound. When a creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you hits with an attack, you can use your reaction to expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. The target of the triggering attack must make a Strength saving throw against your Spell save DC or take thunder damage equal to half of the number rolled and be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Dirge of Dread (Finale)
entries: You play a terrifying dirge to accompany a deathblow, striking fear into the hearts of your nearby enemies. When an ally brings a creature within 60 feet to 0 hitpoints, you can use your reaction to expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. Select a number of creatures within 15 feet of the triggering ally equal to half of the number rolled (minimum 1). Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell save DC or becomed {@ condition frightened} of the triggering ally until the end of that ally's next turn. After the effect ends, or the save is successful, targeted creatures are immune to Dirge of Dread for the next 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Dissonance (Discomfits)
entries: Summoning a harsh, discordant tone. you muddle the mind of an opponent, lessening their defenses. When a creature within 60 feet is forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. You reduce their saving throw by half of the number rolled. You can use this feature after the creature makes its saving throw roll, but before the DM determines a success or failure.

optionalfeature.name: Guiding Dane (Fermata)
entries: You drag a sharp, powerful chord through the mind of a creature. forcing it to suddenly stumble in a direction you wish. As a bonus action, you expend and roll a of Bardic Inspiration die and select a creature other than yourself within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell save DC or take psychic damage equal to half of the number rolled and be pushed 10 feet in a direction you choose. A target can fail the saving throw voluntarily.

optionalfeature.name: Hasten Tempo (Accelerando)
entries: Your manipulation of tempo and song can inspire others to act more quickly. You can use a Bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet. Expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die. adding the number rolled to the creature's initiative and moving them up the initiative order accordingly. If this would move them higher than you. they immediately take their turn after you this round. A creature cannot be affected by Hasten Tempo again until they've finished a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Hymn of Harmony (Armonia)
entries: The melodies surrounding your allies promote rapid recovery. When a creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you regains any hitpoints, they can expend and roll their inspiration die to regain additional hitpoints equal to the number rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Majestic Anthem (Maestoso)
entries: Pulled from the chaos, you muster an uplifting melody that bolsters the resolve of your allies. You can expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die as an action. You and all other creatures you choose within 60 feet, gain temporary hitpoints equal to the number rolled plus your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). These temporary hitpoints last until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Resonance (Risonanza)
entries: You shape the harmonic vibrations of a weapon's movements into a dangerous, sonic enhancement. Using a bonus action, you can expend and roll a Bardic Inspiration die, choosing one weapon within 60 feet of you. Until the end of your next turn, all attacks with that weapon deal additional thunder damage equal to half of number rolled (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Banishing Arrow
entries: You use abjuration magic to try to temporarily banish your target to a harmless location in the Feywild. The creature hit by the arrow must also succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. While banished in this way, the target's speed is 0, and it is {@condition incapacitated}. At the end of its next turn, the target reappears in the space it vacated or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
After you reach 18th level in this class, a target also takes {@damage 2d6} force damage when the arrow hits it.

optionalfeature.name: Beguiling Arrow
entries: Your enchantment magic causes this arrow to temporarily beguile its target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and choose one of your allies within 30 feet of the target. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is {@condition charmed} by the chosen ally until the start of your next turn. This effect ends early if the chosen ally attacks the charmed target, deals damage to it, or forces it to make a saving throw.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Bursting Arrow
entries: You imbue your arrow with force energy drawn from the school of evocation. The energy detonates after your attack. Immediately after the arrow hits the creature, the target and all other creatures within 10 feet of it take {@damage 2d6} force damage each.
The force damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Enfeebling Arrow
entries: You weave necromantic magic into your arrow. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} necrotic damage. The target must also succeed on a Constitution saving throw, or the damage dealt by its weapon attacks is halved until the start of your next turn.
The necrotic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Grasping Arrow
entries: When this arrow strikes its target, conjuration magic creates grasping, poisonous brambles, which wrap around the target. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} poison damage, its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it takes {@damage 2d6} slashing damage the first time on each turn it moves 1 foot or more without teleporting. The target or any creature that can reach it can use its action to remove the brambles with a successful Strength (Athletics) check against your Arcane Shot save DC. Otherwise, the brambles last for 1 minute or until you use this option again.
The poison damage and slashing damage both increase to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Arrow
entries: You use transmutation magic to give your arrow an ethereal quality. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, the arrow shoots forward in a line, which is 1 foot wide and 30 feet long, before disappearing. The arrow passes harmlessly through objects, ignoring cover. Each creature in that line must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} piercing damage. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage.
The piercing damage increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Arrow
entries: Using divination magic, you grant your arrow the ability to seek out a target. When you use this option, you don't make an attack roll for the attack. Instead, choose one creature you have seen in the past minute. The arrow flies toward that creature, moving around corners if necessary and ignoring three-quarters cover and half cover. If the target is within the weapon's range and there is a path large enough for the arrow to travel to the target, the target must make a Dexterity saving throw. Otherwise, the arrow disappears after traveling as far as it can. On a failed save, the target takes damage as if it were hit by the arrow, plus an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage, and you learn the target's current location. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage, and you don't learn its location.
The force damage increases to {@damage 2d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Arrow
entries: You weave illusion magic into your arrow, causing it to occlude your foe's vision with shadows. The creature hit by the arrow takes an extra {@damage 2d6} psychic damage, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be unable to see anything farther than 5 feet away until the start of your next turn.
The psychic damage increases to {@damage 4d6} when you reach 18th level in this class.

optionalfeature.name: Ambush
entries: When you make a Dexterity (Stealth) check or an initiative roll, you can expend one superiority die and add the die to the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Brace
entries: When an enemy you can see moves within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to expend one superiority die and make one weapon attack against that creature. If the attack hits, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Disarming Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to disarm the target, forcing it to drop one item of your choice that it's holding. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it drops the object you choose. The object lands at its feet.

optionalfeature.name: Feinting Attack
entries: You can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action on your turn to feint, choosing one creature within 5 feet of you as your target. You have advantage on your next attack roll against that creature this turn. If that attack hits, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Lunging Attack
entries: When you make a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die to increase your reach for that attack by 5 feet. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Parry
entries: When another creature damages you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to reduce the damage by the number you roll on your superiority die + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

optionalfeature.name: Precision Attack
entries: When you make a weapon attack roll against a creature, you can expend one superiority die to add it to the roll. You can use this maneuver before or after making the attack roll, but before any effects of the attack are applied.

optionalfeature.name: Pushing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to drive the target back. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you push the target up to 15 feet away from you.

optionalfeature.name: Riposte
entries: When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction and expend one superiority die to make a melee weapon attack against the creature. If you hit, you add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Snipe
entries: As a bonus action, you can expend one superiority die and make a ranged weapon attack. You can draw a thrown weapon or load a single piece of ammunition into a crossbow or firearm as part of making this attack. If you hit, add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to damage another creature with the same attack. Choose another creature within 5 feet of the original target and within your reach. If the original attack roll would hit the second creature, it takes damage equal to the number you roll on your superiority die. The damage is of the same type dealt by the original attack.

optionalfeature.name: Trip Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to knock the target down. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and if the target is Large or smaller, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, you knock the target {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Bait and Switch
entries: When you're within 5 feet of an ally on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and switch places with that ally, provided you spend at least 5 feet of movement.
This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.
Roll the superiority die. Until the start of your next turn, the ally gains a bonus to AC equal to the number rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Strike
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can forgo one of your attacks and use a bonus action to direct one of your companions to strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you and expend one superiority die. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack, adding the superiority die to the attack's damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Distracting Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to distract the creature, giving your allies an opening. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll. The next attack roll against the target by an attacker other than you has advantage if the attack is made before the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Evasive Footwork
entries: When you move, you can expend one superiority die, rolling the die and adding the number rolled to your AC until you stop moving.

optionalfeature.name: Goading Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to goad the target into attacking you. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls against targets other than you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Maneuvering Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to maneuver one of your comrades into a more advantageous position. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and you choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature can use its reaction to move up to half its speed without provoking opportunity attacks from the target of your attack.

optionalfeature.name: Menacing Attack
entries: When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can expend one superiority die to attempt to frighten the target. You add the superiority die to the attack's damage roll, and the target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it is {@condition frightened} of you until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Rally
entries: On your turn, you can use a bonus action and expend one superiority die to bolster the resolve of one of your companions. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can see or hear you. That creature gains temporary hit points equal to the superiority die roll + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Restraining Strike
entries: Immediately after you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack on your turn, you can expend one superiority die and use a bonus action to grapple the target. Add the superiority die to your Strength (Athletics) check. The target is also {@condition restrained} while grappled in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Silver Tongue
entries: When you make a Charisma (Deception) check or a Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can expend one superiority die, and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Studious Eye
entries: When you make a Wisdom (Insight) check or an Intelligence (Investigation) check, you can expend one superiority die, and add the superiority die to the ability check.

optionalfeature.name: Bullying Shot
entries: You can use the powerful blast and thundering sound of your firearm to shake the resolve of a creature. When making a Charisma (Intimidation) check, you can expend one grit point to gain advantage on the roll.

optionalfeature.name: Dazing Shot
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to dizzy your opponent. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer disadvantage on attacks until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Deadeye Shot
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to gain advantage on the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Piercing Shot
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to fire through multiple opponents. The initial attack gains a +1 to the firearm's misfire score. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and you make an attack roll with disadvantage against every creature in a line directly behind the target within your first range increment. Only the initial attack can misfire.

optionalfeature.name: Winging Shot
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one grit point to attempt to topple a moving target. On a hit, the creature suffers normal damage and must make a Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

optionalfeature.name: Violent Shot
entries: When you make a firearm attack against a creature, you can expend one or more grit points to enhance the volatility of the attack. For each grit point expended, the attack gains a +2 to the firearm's misfire score. If the attack hits, you can roll one additional weapon damage die per grit point spent when determining the damage.

items: If your Strength score is less than your Wisdom score, your Strength score raises to become equal.

When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher while in this form, your next melee weapon attack while in The Bear form deals an additional {@dice 1d6} radiant damage per level of spell slot expended, up to a maximum of {@dice 4d6}. The bonus damage does not stack, if you cast a spell while you already have the bonus, you must choose which bonus damage to keep.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: For 1 minute, your melee attacks deal an additional {@dice 2d4} radiant damage.

items: Your AC is increased by your proficiency bonus.
You gain advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks when attempting a grapple.
You may add your proficiency bonus to Constitution saving throws.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: For 1 minute, when you are hit by a creature within 5 feet of you, they take {@dice 2d6} radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: The Fish
entries: You and creatures of your choice within 20 feet of you gain the following features:

items: You have a swim speed equal to twice your walking speed.
You can breathe underwater.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: For 1 minute, you create a 15-foot-radius whirlpool centered on a point you can see within 30 feet. This area is difficult terrain for any creatures other than you and any creature other than you that starts its turn in the area must make a Strength saving throw or be pulled under the water, taking {@dice 2d8} bludgeoning damage and being knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, they take half damage and are not knocked {@condition prone}.

items: You can attack an additional time when you take the Attack action.
You can add your proficiency bonus to any Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks.
Your jumping distance is doubled.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: You leap to a target up to 30 feet away and immediately make a melee weapon attack.

items: You gain a flying speed of 60 feet.
You may add your proficiency bonus to any Wisdom (Perception) checks.
You can use your bonus action to mark an enemy giving them disadvantage on attacks made against you, until you leave The Owl form. You can only have one enemy marked at a time.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: Your marked target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the start of your next turn.

items: You gain an Aura of Balance with a radius of 20 feet. All enemies that enter this area for the first time, or start their turn within it, take radiant damage equal to your Wisdom modifier. When an enemy is hurt by this aura, you add all the damage done to a special Pool of Balance.

As an action, you can spend points from your Pool of Balance to restore an equal amount of hit points divided as you choose amongst any number of creatures that you can see within your aura. When you leave The Scales form all unspent hit points are lost.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: You unleash a burst of energy, forcing all enemies in your Aura of Balance to succeed a Dexterity saving throw or lose their balance and fall prone.

items: Your speed increases by 10 feet.
You can move through difficult terrain normally.

You can use your action to sting a target within 10 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} for one minute. The target can repeat the save at the start of each of its turns. On a successful save, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours. Once you leave The Scorpion form, this condition ends.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: You can impose disadvantage on the next saving throw a creature makes against your paralysis.

items: You may add your proficiency bonus to any Charisma (Deception) checks.
A number of targets of your choice equal to your proficiency bonus cannot see this Constellation Form and won't know you are using it.

When you hit a creature with a melee attack in this form, you can use your bonus action to force the target to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target it {@condition poisoned} and on a successful save the target is immune to this effect for the next minute. The poisoned creature can repeat the save at the start of each of its turns. Once you leave The Snake form, this condition ends.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: As part of this bonus action and for 1 minute, you can use the {@action Hide} action as a bonus action, even if you are only lightly obscured.

items: Your walking speed is doubled.
You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.
If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with an attack on the same turn, you can roll one additional weapon damage die.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: For 1 minute, you can walk on water and walls, but must end your turn on solid ground.

items: When you activate this form you immediately cast {@spell mirror image|PHB}, ignoring verbal and somatic components. When you leave The Twins form, the spell ends.

entries.name: Ascendance.
entries: For 1 minute, both you and your clones are under the effects of {@spell blur|phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Become the Teapot
entries: You roll with the incoming energy, attuning to the element, becoming it. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell absorb elements|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Effortless Step
entries: The air around you works in unison with your movements, rising you up as you jump. Your jump height and distance are doubled (quadrupled with Step of the Wind) and you gain advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to jumping.

optionalfeature.name: Enduring Mountain Stance
entries: Your body and mind become as rigid and unyielding as the ground below you. Your ki roots your feet into the ground and you become immovable. When you use the {@action Dodge} action, you cannot be moved, pushed, grappled, frightened, or knocked prone against your will until the start of your next turn, even if magically compelled to do so. You must be standing on the ground to use this ability.

optionalfeature.name: Fangs of the Fire Snake
entries: Your arms and legs become enveloped in roaring gouts of flame. When you make an unarmed attack on your turn, you can choose to strike out tendrils of flames which stretch out beyond your normal reach. Your reach increases by 5 feet for that attack, and it deals fire damage instead of bludgeoning damage. If the attack hits, you can spend 1 ki point to deal an extra {@damage 1d10} fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Fang of the Frost Wolf
entries: You summon a shard of razor-sharp ice and fling it at your foe. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell ice knife|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Fist of Four Thunders
entries: You slam your fists together in front of you, causing a thunderous boom that blows away everything around you. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell thunderwave|phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Fist of Unbroken Air
entries: You summon a swirling wind and concentrate it around your fist. When you make an unarmed attack on your turn, you can choose to strike out condensed bursts of air which stretch out beyond your normal reach. Your reach increases by 10 feet for that attack. If the attack hits you can spend 1 ki point to force the target to make a Strength saving throw or be pushed back 10 feet and be knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Golden Snake's Icy Path
entries: Whenever you take the {@action Dash} action, until the end of your turn for any movement you make along a surface you can leave a trail of slippery ice. This ice counts as difficult terrain and lasts until the start of your next turn. Enemies that move at least 10 feet on the ice must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Rumbling Badger
entries: You shake the ground, causing a tremor that knocks over your foes. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell earth tremor|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Rush of the Gale Spirits
entries: You send a blast of air outward with a thrust of your open palm. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell gust of wind|phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Shape the Raincloud
entries: You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell create or destroy water|phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Cinder Strike
entries: With a wide sweeping gesture, you summon forth a barrage of hot cinders. You can spend 1 ki point to cast {@spell burning hands|phb}.

optionalfeature.name: Water Whip
entries: You summon a long, rubbery whip of pure water that you grip by one end. You can spend 1 ki point as a bonus action to create a whip of water that shoves and pulls a creature to unbalance it. A creature that you can see that is within 30 feet of you must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes bludgeoning damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier, plus an extra {@dice 1d10} bludgeoning damage for each additional ki point you spend, and you can either knock it prone or pull it up to 25 feet closer to you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage, and you do not pull it or knock it prone. You can't use Water Whip and cast a spell during the same turn.

optionalfeature.name: A Leaf on the Wind
entries: A powerful wind rises up to catch you as you fall. Your Slow Fall ability no longer requires a reaction to use, and instead you may use it automatically whenever you are conscious and not incapacitated, and it negates all falling damage regardless of distance. When you use the Slow Fall ability, you may also glide along the air to move 5 feet in any horizontal direction for every 5 feet that you fall.

optionalfeature.name: Burning Ember Flourish
entries: You reach out with your ki to snuff out a source of fire, causing it to go out with a bang or to sputter black smoke. You can spend 2 ki points to cast {@spell pyrotechnics|xge}.

optionalfeature.name: Crushing Hand of the Mountain
entries: You focus your strength into your outstretched fist, summoning a hand of earth from the ground. You can spend 2 ki points to cast maximilian's earthen grasp.

optionalfeature.name: Curtain of Unyielding Wind
entries: You let out a fierce howl as a mighty wind begins swirling around you. You can spend 2 ki points to cast warding wind.

optionalfeature.name: Gong of the Summit
entries: You strike the air as if it were a gong. You can spend 2 ki points to cast shatter.

optionalfeature.name: Hatchling's Flame
entries: You focus your ki into a torrent of fire that streaks away from you. You can spend 2 ki points to cast aganazzar's scorcher.

optionalfeature.name: Impenetrable Iron Tortoise Shell
entries: You summon an earthen barrier to defend yourself or an ally. As a reaction, you may spend 2 ki points to use your Deflect Missiles ability against an attack you can see within 30 feet of you. Any damage not prevented by this ability is taken by the original target of the attack. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can't make an attack with it.

optionalfeature.name: Mote of the Sun
entries: Your ki manifests as a roaring orb of fire. You can spend 2 ki points to cast flaming sphere.

optionalfeature.name: Patient Badger Listens
entries: You reach out with your ki to the ground beneath you. You can spend 2 ki points as a bonus action to gain tremorsense with a range of 30 feet and a burrow speed equal to half of your walking speed for up to 1 minute. Your movement leaves behind a tunnel that remains for as long as this ability is active, then collapses.

optionalfeature.name: Red Dragon's Claws
entries: Rays of fire spring from your outstretched hand to sear your foes. You can spend 2 ki points to cast scorching ray.

optionalfeature.name: Swarming Ice Rabbit
entries: A flurry of magic snowballs erupts from a point you choose within range. You can spend 2 ki points to cast snilloc's snowball swarm.

optionalfeature.name: Water Jet
entries: You can spend 2 ki points as an action to unleash a jet of water in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a Strength saving throw, taking bludgeoning damage equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. In addition, you can move each target that fails its saving throw to any unoccupied space touching the line.

optionalfeature.name: Dance of Three Ways
entries: You summon six spheres of earth from the ground, suspend them in the air around you, and ignite them with your fiery ki. With a thought, you launch these blazing meteors at your foe. You can spend 3 ki points to cast melf's minute meteors.

optionalfeature.name: Earth Reaches for Sky
entries: Focusing your strength with a deep, rumbling shout, you swing your arms up high, causing an eruption of churned earth and stone that engulfs your foes. You can spend 3 ki points to cast erupting earth.

optionalfeature.name: Eternal Mountain Defense
entries: Your body hardens to stone, nearly impervious to weapons. You can spend 4 ki points to cast stoneskin, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Flames of the Phoenix
entries: With a hand motion, you conjure a tiny bead of burning energy. You spend 3 ki points to cast fireball.

optionalfeature.name: Fist of the Elements
entries: The elements swirl around your weapon. You can spend 3 ki points to cast elemental weapon, choosing from only the damage types: cold, fire, or thunder. Your unarmed strikes count as a weapon for the purposes of this discipline.

optionalfeature.name: Hua's Water Prison
entries: You conjure up a sphere of water that engulfs and imprisons foes that touch its surface. You can spend 4 ki to cast watery sphere.

optionalfeature.name: Mist Stance
entries: A swirling mist envelopes your body and you merge with it, becoming a cloud. You can spend 3 ki points to cast gaseous form, targeting yourself.

optionalfeature.name: One with the Tides
entries: You reach out with your ki and become one with water. You spend 2 ki points as an action to gain underwater adaptations for 8 hours. While this ability is active, you can breath normally underwater, you gain a swim speed equal to your walking speed, and you gain blindsight with a radius of 60 feet while underwater.

optionalfeature.name: Rain of the Frigid Glacier
entries: You cool the air in the skies above you, condensing the water droplets into freezing rain and sleet. You can spend 3 ki points to cast sleet storm.

optionalfeature.name: Raise the Troubled Earth
entries: You stir the earth around you into action, summoning a wall of sand to serve as your barricade. You can spend 3 ki to cast wall of sand.

optionalfeature.name: Raise the Still Waters
entries: Though water can give way easily, it can just as easily offer great resistance. You can spend 3 ki to cast wall of water.

optionalfeature.name: Ride the Wind
entries: You summon a mighty wind that envelopes your body, sweeping you to where you want to go. You spend 3 ki points to cast fly, targeting yourself, except your fly speed is equal to your movement speed.

optionalfeature.name: River of Hungry Flame
entries: You sweep your hands upward, causing a wall of blazing hot fire to leap up from the ground. You can spend 4 ki points to cast wall of fire.

optionalfeature.name: Sea's Fury
entries: You conjure up a mighty wave of water that crashes down on your foes. You can spend 3 ki to cast tidal wave.

optionalfeature.name: Shape of the Flowing River
entries: You touch the body of water with your ki, coaxing it to change its form. You can spend 4 ki points to cast control water.

optionalfeature.name: Spellfist Stance
entries: You effortlessly flow between martial and elemental assault. When you use your action to use an elemental discipline, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action, or you can use your Flurry of Blows.

optionalfeature.name: Sweeping Crosswind
entries: A wall of strong wind rises from the ground, batting away anything in its path. You can spend 3 ki points to cast wind wall.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Elements
entries: As an ultimate display of your mastery of the elements, you can spend 5 ki as an action to have the elements of earth, fire, air, and water form a protective sphere around your body, gaining multiple benefits for 1 minute. While this ability is active, you have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder damage. You also gain a burrow, fly, and swim speed equal to your movement speed. Lastly, you can use any of the following abilities as a bonus action:

items: You create a small earthquake on the ground in a 15-foot radius around you. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone.

You create a line of fire 15 feet long and 5 feet wide extending from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

You create a 15-foot cube of swirling wind centered on a point you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 1d10 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a Large or smaller creature fails the save, that creature is also pushed up to 10 feet away from the center of the cube.

You create a 15-foot cone of ice shards extending from your outstretched hand in a direction you choose. Each creature in the cone must make a Constitution save throw. A creature takes 2d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails its save against this effect has its speed halved until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Breath of Winter
entries: You inhale deeply and then exhale, blasting a cone of frigid air out in front of you that freezes everything in its path. You can spend 5 ki points to cast cone of cold.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of Fire
entries: Your foes may try to hide in darkness, but their ki lights up like a torch to you. You may cast see invisibility without expending any ki. In addition, while under the effects of see invisibility, you may spend 2 ki points as a bonus action to gain truesight until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Eye of the Hurricane
entries: You stretch out your ki to embrace the winds. You can spend 5 ki points to cast control winds.

optionalfeature.name: Mold the Mountain
entries: You master the many forms that earth may take. You can spend 5 ki to cast transmute rock.

optionalfeature.name: Swirling Crab's Revenge
entries: Your ki manifests as a swirling pool of water, smashing and pulling your foes towards its center. You can spend 5 ki points to cast maelstrom.

optionalfeature.name: Wave of Rolling Earth
entries: The ground shakes and emits a low rumble as a wall of stone erupts up into being. You can spend 5 ki points to cast wall of stone.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Brand
entries: Your patron marks your body with a symbol or feature indicative of their influence, called a Pact Mark, a vestige of their influence used to store and channel arcane power. Your mark is a symbol, like a tattoo or a blemish, or a physical feature, such as a unique eye or a wound, and cannot be removed unless the body part it is on is also removed. Your mark, and by extension your body, counts as an arcane focus for your warlock spells.

Whenever you expend a warlock spell slot, your mark gains a charge, to a maximum amount equal to your warlock spell slot level. You can use your mark to cast a spell you know, expending a number of charges equal to the level you cast the spell at. Your mark loses any charges when you complete a long rest, and you cannot gain more charges than half your warlock level (rounded up) per long rest.

If you lose your mark, you can perform a 1-hour ritual to entreat your patron to give you another in a new location. This ritual can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous mark.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Cards
entries: Your patron grants you a simple box made of wood or iron, engraved with your name at the bottom. Upon inspection, the box appears empty. While the box is on your person, you are proficient with all gaming sets.

Additionally, you can use your action to draw a card from the box which magically appears in your hand as you reach into it. If you do so, roll on the Fate Cards table to determine the card's effect. Spells cast as part of this action don't require components. Once you have drawn a card and its magic has taken effect, it crumbles to dust. You can only draw one card at a time.
Once you have drawn a number of cards equal to your Charisma modifier, you must finish a long rest before you can draw additional cards.
If you lose the box, you can perform a 1-hour ritual to receive a replacement from the Fateful. The ritual can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous box.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Cowl
entries: You are granted a mystical cowl made of otherworldly material from your warlock patron. While wearing this cowl and no other armor, you gain an AC of 12 + your Charisma modifier, as well as proficiency in the Stealth skill if you do not already have it. When performing a Stealth check while wearing the cowl, you may substitute your Charisma modifier for Dexterity.

The cowl is psychically bonded to you, and you can equip it as a bonus action and dismiss it without any action required. If you lose the cowl, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. The cowl disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for one minute or more, or if you die.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Key
entries: Your patron grants you the power to open new paths for yourself... in a curious way. You obtain a small key that magically adjusts to any lock you attempt to fit it into.

When you insert your pact key into a lock, make a spellcasting ability check contested by the door's DC (determined by your DM). On a success, the key successfully opens the lock and disarms or disables any traps associated with it. Once you attempt to open a lock this way, the key's form towards that lock remains unchanged until next dawn.
If you lose your pact key, you can perform a 1-hour ritual to receive a replacement key. This ritual can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous key.

optionalfeature.name: Pact of the Lamp
entries: The Noble Genie grants you a Genie Lamp, an ornate oil lamp decorated with nine jewels from its lavish palace. While unattended, the lamp has an AC of 10 and 10 hit points. While you are holding the lamp, you can use your action to teleport yourself to an extradimensional space located inside the lamp. The space is the size of a 15-foot radius, 20 foot high cylinder, and it is furnished and decorated as you choose.
Any creature inside the extradimensional space perceives sound as though it occupied the space of the Genie Lamp, in addition to its normal senses.

While you are holding the Genie Lamp or you are inside its extradimensional space, you can use your action to expel any creature inside the space to the nearest unoccupied space it can occupy. If the lamp is destroyed, all creatures and objects inside the space are expelled to the nearest unoccupied space they can occupy. Furnishings and other objects created by this feature dissipate into smoke if removed from the lamp.

If you lose your Genie Lamp, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. The ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous lamp. The lamp disintegrates into a trace of elemental energy akin to your patron when you die.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Thorns
entries: You add half your warlock level to the damage of your thorn whip as additional acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Acid Wave
entries: When you cast acid splash, you can target a number of additional creatures equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). Each target of the spell must be within 5 feet of another target.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of Viryn
entries: You can cast spells as though you were in the space of the glowing humanoid form created by dancing lights, but you must use your own senses.

optionalfeature.name: Baalzebul's Folly
entries: If a creature fails its saving throw against vicious mockery, it falls prone if it moves more than half of its speed before the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blackland Wanderer
entries: You can use your action to make a melee attack with a weapon under the effect of shillelagh against a creature within reach. On a hit, the target takes additional force damage equal to your warlock level.

optionalfeature.name: Candy Coating
entries: You can cast barkskin without expending a spell slot once per short or long rest. However, casting it in this way you can only target yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Cape of Icarus
entries: Once per long rest, you can take an action to transform you cowl into a pair of wings and launch into the air. Your flying speed is 30 for up to 5 minutes, or until you lose concentration. When the duration ends, you fall if you are still in the air.

optionalfeature.name: Card Dealer
entries: Other willing creatures can use their action to draw a card from your box as if they used the Pact of the Cards feature. Cards drawn by other creatures count against the number of cards you can draw between long rests.

optionalfeature.name: Celestial Blessing
entries: When you cast guidance or resistance, you can target additional creatures in range with the same spell, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one).

optionalfeature.name: Cloak of Concealment
entries: While you are wearing your cowl, you may cast the nondetection spell on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Contingent Reserve
entries: You can cast a spell of 1st-level or higher into your pact mark, expending the spell slot accordingly. The spell has no effect, and you can set a trigger for the spell, such as when a creature hits you with a weapon attack. When the trigger is met, you can use your reaction to cast the spell without expending a spell slot. This spell is lost when you complete a long rest, removing it from your mark.

optionalfeature.name: Covenant of the Pact Keeper
entries: Your pact mark's magic improves, granting you the power of a single magical item. Your mark now acts as a magic item that requires attunement and gains the effects of one of the following magical items: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location, Brooch of Shielding, Cloak of Elvenkind or Gloves of Missile Snaring. While attuned to the mark, you gain the benefits of the chosen item.

optionalfeature.name: Disappearing Act
entries: While you are wearing your cowl, you can cast misty step at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Door to Destiny
entries: You always know the location of the box granted to you by the Pact of the Cards feature while both of you are on the same plane of existence.

While the box is within 500 feet of you, you can cast dimension door without expending a spell slot, targeting a space within 10 feet of the box. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Dreams of the Summer Court
entries: When you cast minor illusion, its range is 300 feet, and you can choose the illusion to be imperceptible to any number of creatures you have seen in the past minute.

optionalfeature.name: Emissary of the Tides
entries: Whenever you use your Wrath of the Sea feature, you are considered to be under the effects of sanctuary for the next minute. The spell still breaks as per the spell's description but you regain its effects at the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Empyrean Light
entries: Non-hostile creatures within the bright light created by the light spell can reroll any 1 on a die rolled to restore hit points, but they must use the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Vines
entries: The range of your thorn whip doubles, and so does the distance it can pull a creature. Additionally, you can push a creature away from you, instead of pulling it toward you.

optionalfeature.name: Extraplanar Awareness
entries: When you roll for Initiative, you can treat the d20 roll of 8 or lower as a number equal to 8 + your Charisma modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Lance
entries: When you cast ray of frost, each creature in a 1 foot wide line between you and the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes cold damage equal to half your warlock level.

optionalfeature.name: Gaze into Mortal Hearts
entries: You can spend an action to learn the nature of a humanoid creature you can see within 120 feet of you, that has an Intelligence of 6 or higher. You learn its alignment and its most prevalent moral or behavioral tendency (violent, altruistic, aloof, etc.).

For 1 minute after doing this, treat any d20 roll for a Wisdom (Insight) check against the creature that is 11 or lower, as a 12. After the minute ends, the target is immune to this effect for 24 hours.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, and regain all uses when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of Three Crowns
entries: If you know the druidcraft, prestidigitation, or thaumaturgy cantrip, you also know the other two cantrips from that list. They don't count against your number of cantrips known.

optionalfeature.name: Gingerbread Familiar
entries: When your familiar eats a candy created by your Sweet Tooth feature, it regains all of its missing hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Grasp of the Storm Lord
entries: When you cast shocking grasp, you can expend a warlock spell slot to amplify the attack. You gain a bonus to the attack roll equal to the level of the spell slot. If the attack hits, the target takes an extra 1d8 lightning damage per level of the spell slot and it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or it is paralyzed until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Green Tongue
entries: You can cast speak with plants at-will.

optionalfeature.name: Hallowed Flame
entries: When you deal damage to a fiend or undead with sacred flame, you can deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

optionalfeature.name: Hand of Chains
entries: As an action, you can command your mage hand to grapple a Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. The hand's Strength score equals your Charisma score, which you use to resolve the grapple.

optionalfeature.name: Healing Splash
entries: You gain the ability to target a friendly creature with eldritch blast and reinvigorate them in the midst of battle. Instead of suffering damage, the target gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage they would take.
You regain the use of this feature when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Hidden Palace
entries: The extradimensional space located inside your Genie Lamp is now the size of a 30-foot radius, 60 foot high cylinder. While you are holding the lamp, you can use your action to teleport a willing creature you can see within 10 feet of you to the extradimensional space.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Pact Mark
entries: Your pact mark grants a +1 bonus to your spell save DC and spell attack rolls for warlock spells you cast.

optionalfeature.name: Lamp of Greed
entries: While you are holding your Genie Lamp, you know the exact location of any electrum, gold, and platinum piece within 30 feet of you.

optionalfeature.name: Lamp of Opulence
entries: When a creature casts a spell that has a material component worth more than 1 gp while holding your Genie Lamp, it can remove gems from the lamp to reduce the required value of the component for this casting of the spell. The required value is reduced by 50 gp for every gem removed this way. Once removed, a gem dissipates into smoke.

Whenever you finish a long rest, a new gem appears on your Genie Lamp (to a maximum of nine). When you receive a replacement for your lamp, the new lamp is decorated with the same number of gems as the previous lamp.

optionalfeature.name: Mephistopheles' Regards
entries: When you attack a creature with the flame created by produce flame, you can expend a warlock spell slot to unleash a fiery explosion at the target's location. The target and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d4 fire damage per level of the spell slot. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Manipulator
entries: When the friends spell ends, the target of the spell must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or it is unaware that is has been affected by magic.

optionalfeature.name: Parachute
entries: While you are wearing your cowl, you may cast feather fallon yourself at will, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Planar Sync
entries: You can maintain a sense of magnetic north and the passage of time, even across planes such as the Ethereal Plane, the Feywild and the Shadow.

optionalfeature.name: Plentiful Sweets
entries: As an action, you can expend a warlock spell slot to create a number of candies from your Sweet Tooth feature equal to the level of the spell slot expended. These candies do not count towards your limit that can be created using the Sweet Tooth ability, and there is no limit on how many you can create of a specific type; however, they do still disappear when you take a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sacrifice
entries: You can cast life transference once without expending a spell slot. You may choose to cast the spell using this feature of a level equal to or lower than the current level of your spell slots gained from your Pact Magic warlock feature. You regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Safe Passage
entries: You can target and pull a willing ally using your thorn whipwithout damaging them. This movement does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Arcana
entries: A creature that touches your pact mark when casting a spell can choose for it to be stored within the pact mark, provided it is on the sorcerer, warlock or wizard spell list. The spell has no effect and the slot is still consumed. Until you or the creature completes a long rest, you can expend charges from the mark to cast the spell as if it were a warlock spell.

optionalfeature.name: Shortcut of the Earthmother
entries: You can cast transport via plants once without expending a spell slot, and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Shuffled Spell
entries: Whenever you finish a long rest, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

optionalfeature.name: Spell Stealer
entries: When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you casts a spell, you can use your reaction to consume any leftover magical energy, gaining charges equal to half the spell's level (rounded up). If you cast counterspell, you can use this feature with the same reaction. You can use this feature once, and regain the ability to do so when you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sugary Strikes
entries: When you critically strike with your pact weapon, you gain the effects of your Sugar Rush feature.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of Renewal
entries: You can use mending to reattach a creature's severed body parts such as fingers, legs, tails, and so on.

optionalfeature.name: Touch of the Grave
entries: A humanoid killed by chill touch rises up as a zombie at the start of your next turn. The zombie pursues whatever creature it can see that is closest to it. It remains animated for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), after which time the zombie becomes inanimate once more.

optionalfeature.name: Water's Care
entries: You can cast aid once without expending a spell slot once per long rest. You cast the spell of a level equal to the current level of spell slots gained from your Pact Magic warlock feature.

optionalfeature.name: Waters of Minauros
entries: When a creature fails its saving throw against poison spray, it is poisoned until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Witchwood Step
entries: You can cast expeditious retreat at will, without expending a spell slot. When you take the Dash action on your turn while under the effect of the expeditious retreat spell, you can move across liquids until you stop moving.

tools: three {@item musical instrument|PHB|musical instruments} of your choice

default: (a) a {@item rapier|phb}, (b) a {@item longsword|phb}, or (c) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon}
(a) a {@item diplomat's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item entertainer's pack|phb}
(a) a {@item lute|phb} or (b) any other {@filter musical instrument|items|miscellaneous=mundane|type=instrument}

tools: one {@item musical instrument|PHB} of your choice

fluff.name: Bard
entries: Humming as she traces her fingers over an ancient monument in a long-forgotten ruin, a half-elf in rugged leathers finds knowledge springing into her mind, conjured forth by the magic of her song—knowledge of the people who constructed the monument and the mythic saga it depicts.

A stern human warrior bangs his sword rhythmically against his scale mail, setting the tempo for his war chant and exhorting his companions to bravery and heroism. The magic of his song fortifies and emboldens them.
Laughing as she tunes her cittern, a gnome weaves her subtle magic over the assembled nobles, ensuring that her companions' words will be well received.
Whether scholar, skald, or scoundrel, a bard weaves magic through words and music to inspire allies, demoralize foes, manipulate minds, create illusions, and even heal wounds.

entries.name: Music and Magic
