subclassFeature.name: Way of the Earthen Anchor
entries: Way of the Earthen Anchor monks are strong and wise, but stubborn. They model their strength after their connection with the earth, which they find scared. A monk of this path deliberates before making their stand, but they are unparalleled in holding the line. Despite their stoicism, their connection with the earthen wellspring grants them incredible empathy, and they have been known to uproot themselves in times of dire need and sacrifice themselves for the greater good.

entries.subclassFeature: Dug In|Monk|PHB|Way of the Earthen Anchor|Hergard|3
Earthen Armor|Monk|PHB|Way of the Earthen Anchor|Hergard|3

subclassFeature.name: Dug In
entries: At 3rd level when you choose this tradition, you can dig your feet into the ground, granting you unparalleled stability. As a bonus action you may spend 1 ki point to enter a stance during which you gain the following benefits until the start of your next turn:

items: Your speed is equal to the bonus movement gained from your Unarmored Movement monk feature, you are immune to forced movement and cannot be knocked prone.
Your unarmed strikes deal double damage to structures.

Before you make an unarmed strike, you can choose to take a penalty to the attack roll equal to your proficiency bonus. If the attack hits, you add a bonus to the attack's damage equal to double your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Earthen Armor
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can utilize your monk training to use a special armor made from ki-projected and enhanced stone plates. Those who wear this armor can still benefit from monk features such as Martial Arts, as the armor is an outward manifestation of your ki. You can fashion this armor with an hour of meditation and light activity. You may choose to dismiss this armor at will, but you can make it reform around you as a bonus action. When your armor is finally functional, you may add half your proficiency bonus to your Armor Class and you gain tremorsense up to a range of 30 feet while wearing it.

subclassFeature.name: Warding Stone
entries: Starting at 6th level, earth and stone protects you and comes to your aid in need. You can create a temporary pillar of stone to shield you from attacks.

As a reaction to being hit by an attack, you pull up a 5-feet-diameter and 15-feet-high cylinder of solid earth and stone. The triggering attack hits the pillar instead, and if a target is in the column's space, it is pushed 5 feet backwards in a straight line away from you or towards the nearest unoccupied space. The column has hit points equal to twice your monk level, and an AC of 15. When the column drops to 0 hit points it crumbles into loose earth.
You must finish a short or long rest before you can use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: One with the Earth
entries: Beginning at 11th level, your closer connection with the earth has allowed you to both weaponize it and feel the great surrounding. As an action, you can spend ki points up to your proficiency bonus to cast earthen disk at a level equal to the ki points spent.

Additionally, if you spend 10 minutes in a deep state of meditation, you enter a trance in which you have tremorsense out to a mile around you and you may cast the move earthspell while meditating without material components. You are blind and prone while meditating, and this meditative state ends if you move or attack.
You regain the use of this ability when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Martyr's Tomb
entries: At 17th level, you can mitigate the harm done to your allies. If you are subject to an area of effect that requires a dexterity saving throw, such as a dragon's breath or a fireball spell, and you are within 30 feet of the point of origin, you can use your reaction and spend 3 ki points. In doing so, you immediately move to the origin point of the effect and become the only target of the area effect. You make the saving throw with disadvantage and you fall prone after taking the damage.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Equilibrium
entries: The planes are many things: new frontiers, unique communities, and powerful challenges await travelers to these separate dimensions. However, beyond simply presenting the multiverse with different worlds, the planes represent ideologies that govern the multiverse as a whole. The planes balance the forces of Law and Chaos in the multiverse, keeping any one from becoming too powerful and dominating all of existence.
Monks of this way have attuned their ki specifically to the forces of this balance, and trained in the techniques that allow their very actions to balance the scales at their most minute levels.

subclassFeature.name: Balanced Spirit
entries: At 3rd level when you choose this tradition, you learn to balance your spirit and steel yourself against attacks that would seek to sway you. You have advantage on saving throws made to resist charm and fear effects.

subclassFeature.name: Ki Imbalance
entries: Also at 3rd level, you dedicate even your smallest actions to the balance of law and chaos, rectifying every imbalance in the shortest possible instant. Your unarmed strikes carry with them the powers of law and chaos, and when a creature is struck with one, its ki can become imbalanced.

At the end of your turn, if you made at least one successful unarmed strike on that turn, you can choose to spend 1 ki point to trigger an imbalance in the ki of one of the targets you struck. The effect of this imbalance is dependent upon how many successful unarmed strikes you made, and if that number was even or odd:

entries.name: Even.
entries: Even numbers are considered lawful because each number balances with another in perfect orderly harmony. A lawful imbalance in a target causes it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save the target cannot take bonus actions or reactions until the beginning of your next turn.

entries.name: Odd.
entries: Odd numbers are considered chaotic as they are always imbalanced. A chaotic imbalance in a target causes it to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target is compelled on its next turn to move up to its speed in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The effect ends at the beginning of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Balanced Body
entries: By 6th level, you have honed your physical balance to superhuman levels. You can never be knocked prone as the result of a nonmagical effect. Additionally you have advantage on acrobatics and athletics checks made to hold your balance.

subclassFeature.name: Balanced Mind
entries: Starting at 11th level, you learn to balance others near you, resetting their dispositions. As an action on your turn, you can spend 1 ki point to cause a creature you are touching to experience both of the effects of the calm emotions spell as if you had cast it at 2nd level. The DC to resist this effect is equal to your Ki save DC.

subclassFeature.name: Ki Rearrangement
entries: At 17th level, you learn that a creature's ki can be rearranged entirely, changing their worldview and alignment. When you would normally trigger a ki imbalance in a target, you can choose to rearrange its ki instead without spending Ki points. The creature immediately takes 5d6 psychic damage and must make a Charisma saving throw against your Ki save DC. On a failed save, the creature has its alignment shifted one step in the direction of law or chaos, which you choose. For example, a lawful evil creature could only be shifted to be neutral evil, while a true neutral character could be shifted to lawful neutral or chaotic neutral.

The creature does not lose any memories during this change, but they may be re-contextualized thanks to its new alignment. This could lead to the creature becoming friendly, hostile, or indifferent to you depending on the changes made.

At the end of every 30 days the creature can repeat its saving throw against this effect. If the creature succeeds on this saving throw, the effect ends and the creature reverts to its original alignment.

If a creature is affected by this ability, you cannot use it again until that creature succeeds on its saving throw and ends the effect. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Four Elements
entries: You follow a monastic tradition that teaches you to harness the elements. When you focus your ki, you can align yourself with the forces of creation and bend the four elements to your will, using them as an extension of your body. Some members of this tradition dedicate themselves to a single element, but others weave the elements together.
Many monks of this tradition tattoo their bodies with representations of their ki powers, commonly imagined as coiling dragons, but also as phoenixes, fish, plants, mountains, and cresting waves.

entries.subclassFeature: Initiate of the Way|Monk|PHB|Way of the Four Elements|Hergard|3
Disciple of the Elements|Monk|PHB|Way of the Four Elements|Hergard|3
3rd Level Elemental Disciplines|Monk|PHB|Way of the Four Elements|Hergard|3

subclassFeature.name: Initiate of the Way
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you learn how to manipulate the four elements in subtle ways.
You learn two of the following cantrips: control flames, gust, mold earth, or shape water. You learn two additional cantrips from this list at 6th level.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of the Elements
entries: At 3rd level, you learn magical disciplines that harness the power of the four elements. Some disciplines require you to spend ki points when you use them.

You learn two elemental disciplines of your choice, which are detailed in the elemental disciplines sections below. You learn two additional elemental disciplines of your choice at 6th, 11th, and 17th level.
Whenever you learn a new elemental discipline, you can also replace one elemental discipline that you already know with a different discipline.

entries.name: Casting Elemental Spells.
entries: Some elemental disciplines allow you to cast spells. See chapter 10 of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting. To cast one of these spells, you use its casting time and other rules, but you do not need to provide material components for it. When you cast a spell with a discipline, it is cast at the spell's lowest level unless otherwise specified.

Once you reach 5th level in this class, you can spend additional ki points to increase the level of an elemental discipline spell that you cast, provided that the spell has an enhanced effect at a higher level, as burning hands does. The spell's level increases by 1 for each additional ki point you spend. For example, if you are a 5th-level monk and use Sweeping Cinder Strike to cast burning hands, you can spend 2 ki points to cast it as a 2nd-level spell (the discipline's base cost of 1 ki point plus 1).

The maximum number of ki points (its base ki point cost plus any additional points) that you can spend on the spell is 2, unless a discipline specifies otherwise. This maximum increases to 3 at 9th level, 4 at 13th level, and 5 at 17th level.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Morvanna
entries: The Morvanna is a branch of the Cobalt Soul, an esoteric group of acolytes who worship the knowledge and power of dreams and nightmares. Monks of this order spend night after night perfecting a form of meditation that can access a communal dream shared by all of their order. Within this dream, generations of monks have recorded legends, forgotten tomes, ancient histories, and much more.

subclassFeature.name: Dreamer's Meditation
entries: At 3rd level when you choose this tradition, you gain the ability to access a communal dream through deep meditation. Whenever you sleep you find yourself in the Dreaming, and no longer dream normally. The Dreaming takes a unique form to each practitioner, though any dreamer is able to make use of the information the Morvanna has stored there.

If you spend a long rest sleeping or doing an activity akin to sleeping such as meditating or in a trance, you may study the Dreaming, looking for information of your choice. At the end of the long rest, you may make an Intelligence check with advantage, as though you were in a library researching that information.

Once you reach 11th level in this class, you may instead choose to spend your time in the Dreaming traveling through dreamlands of others. When you use this feature, you may forgo its normal effects to instead cast dream (with you as the messenger) or scrying. When cast it in this way, these spells do not require material components, and the scrying spell cannot benefit from any physical connection.

subclassFeature.name: Unwanted Visions
entries: Also at 3rd level, you learn how to trigger memories of past dreams, both good and bad, by striking particular nerves. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can force them to make a Wisdom saving throw.
On a failure, they take psychic damage equal to your Wisdom modifier, and are either charmed by you or frightened of you (your choice) until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Bond
entries: Starting at 6th level, you may choose to spend some time in your dream visiting those near you, calming them and opening their minds. At the end of a long rest, up to 5 humanoids of your choice, other than yourself, who slept or otherwise finished the long rest within 60 feet of you each gain temporary hit points equal to your monk level + your Wisdom modifier.

Those creatures become bonded to your dream for up to 24 hours, or until they no longer have these temporary hit points. While bonded with a creature in this way, you may telepathically communicate with them if they are within 60 feet, and they gain a bonus to saving throws against being frightened. This bonus is equal to your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Dreamer's Insight
entries: Beginning at 11th level, the dreamer can sometimes tap into knowledge their conscious mind cannot understand, giving brief flashes of insight during combat and letting them make last minute changes to their movements.

When a creature hits you with an attack, you can spend 2 ki points as a reaction to gain insight into their future attacks. Until the end of your next turn, you don't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature, and their attack rolls against you have disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Waking Dream
entries: At 17th level, you have spent so much time within the Dreaming that it and the real world blur together, altering your mind beyond mortal recognition.
You are immune to psychic damage and the charmed and frightened conditions, and can always perceive illusions for what they are.
Additionally, if a creature attempts to charm you, frighten you, or read your thoughts, they must make an Intelligence saving throw, or take psychic damage equal to twice your martial arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Sun Soul
entries: Monks of the Way of the Sun Soul learn to channel their life energy into searing bolts of light. They teach that meditation can unlock the ability to unleash the indomitable light shed by the soul of every living creature.

entries.subclassFeature: Manifest Radiance|Monk|PHB|Way of the Sun Soul|Hergard|3
Radiant Sun Bolt|Monk|PHB|Way of the Sun Soul|Hergard|3

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Radiance
entries: As you hone your abilities, you learn how to channel ki to manifest different forms of light.

You learn the dancing lights cantrip and can cast it without material components. As you gain levels in this class, you gain the ability to cast certain spells shown in the table below, by spending a number of ki points equal to their level. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is Wisdom. When cast in this way, these spells don't require material components.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Sun Bolt
entries: Starting when you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can hurl searing bolts of magical radiance.

You gain a new attack option that you can use when you would make an unarmed strike. This special attack is a ranged weapon attack with a normal range of 30 feet and no long range. You are proficient with it, and you add your Dexterity or Wisdom modifier to its attack and damage rolls. Its damage is radiant, and its damage die is a d4. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.

subclassFeature.name: Searing Arc Strike
entries: At 6th level, you gain the ability to channel your ki into a searing wave of energy.

Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can spend 2 ki points to make one special attack as a bonus action. This special attack is in the shape of a radiant arc, represented by a 15-foot-wide, 5-foot-long line in front of you.

Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes radiant damage equal to three rolls of your martial arts die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

You can spend additional ki points to increase the damage dealt by this attack. Each additional ki point you spend increases the amount of martial arts dice rolled by 1. The maximum number of ki points (2 plus any additional points) that you can spend in order to increase this damage is equal to your proficiency bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Searing Sunburst
entries: At 11th level, you gain the ability to create an orb of light that erupts into a devastating explosion. As an action, you magically create an orb and hurl it at a point you choose within 150 feet, where it erupts into a sphere of radiant light for a brief but deadly instant.

Each creature in that 20-foot-radius sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 radiant damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one. A creature doesn't need to make the save if the creature is behind total cover that is opaque.
You can increase the sphere's damage by spending ki points. Each point you spend, to a maximum of 3, increases the damage by 2d6.

subclassFeature.name: Sun Shield
entries: At 17th level, you can become wreathed in a luminous, magical aura. You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can extinguish or restore the light as a bonus action.
If a creature hits you with a melee attack while this light shines, you can use your reaction to deal radiant damage to the creature. The radiant damage equals 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

As a bonus action you can spend 3 ki points to activate a radiant protective shield around you that lasts for a minute or until you use a bonus action and extinguish the shield along with the light you shed.
While the shield is active you gain the following benefits:

items: The light you shed becomes sunlight
You have resistance to radiant and necrotic damage
When a creature hits you with a melee attack, you can choose to deal radiant damage to the creature equal to 5 + your Wisdom modifier.

When you use your reaction to deal radiant damage to a creature, you can attempt to blind it. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Ki save DC or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of the Tempest
entries: The Oath of the Storm is as ancient as the storm gods themselves. Paladins who swear this oath are sometimes known as Storm Lords, Thunder Riders, or Tempest Knights. In the eternal struggle between law and chaos, good and evil, paladins of the storm channel the chaos of the raw, untamed power that throbs in the skies above, and understand that life can flourish even out of great destruction. Their armor is often adorned with lightning bolts and thunderclouds.

entries.subclassFeature: Tenets of the Tempest|Paladin|PHB|Oath of the Tempest|Hergard|3

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of the Tempest
entries: The chaotic nature of the Tempest makes some question the necessity or legitimacy of these tenets, but nevertheless these are the words that have been passed down for countless generations by warriors who have lived and died by them.

entries.name: Gale.
entries: It is not your place to remain in one area for long. There are many battles to be won on the next horizon.

entries.name: Thunder.
entries: Be the voice for the voiceless. Speak for the downtrodden and the oppressed. Be the fury to those who would subjugate the innocent.

entries.name: Lightning.
entries: Life is short and fleeting. When in doubt, know that now is the time to leave your mark on to world.

entries.name: Downpour.
entries: Be a cleansing and restorative force, ensure that the world you live in today will be a better place tomorrow, and all days to come.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

entries.caption: Oath of the Tempest Spells
rows: {@spell cone of cold|PHB}, {@spell steel wind strike|xge}

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Eye of the Storm.
entries: Your oath gives you the ability to temper the power of storms. As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak words of warding. Any natural storm does not affect the area around you in a 10 foot radius for one hour. Magical storms cannot be affected with this Channel Divinity. The radius expands to 30 feet when you reach 18th level.

entries.name: Thunderous Rebuff.
entries: When you take damage from a creature within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to halve the damage. Condensed sound erupts out from your body, and the creature who damaged you must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes thunder damage equal to 2d8 + your paladin level on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of the Storm
entries: Starting at 7th level, you and friendly creatures within 10 feet of you gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, as a bonus action, you can cause a strong wind to whirl around you until you dismiss it (no action required), causing the following effects:

items: Unprotected flames, torch-sized or smaller, are extinguished.
The area counts as difficult terrain. You can choose any number of creatures to be immune to this effect.
It hedges out vapor, gas, and fog that can be dispersed by strong wind.

entries: At 18th level, the radius of this aura extends to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Aura of the Storm
entries: Starting at 15th level, whenever a hostile creature within your aura makes an attack against you and you are not incapacitated, it takes lightning damage equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Avatar of the Tempest
entries: At 20th level, as an action, you can mantle the powers of a tempest deity. For 1 minute, your body crackles with thunder and lightning, and your eyes glow blue, revealing the raging storm within. You gain the following benefits:

items: You are immune to lightning and thunder damage.

You have a fly speed of 60 feet. If you move 20 feet or more straight toward a creature right before hitting it with a melee attack, the attack deals an extra 1d10 thunder damage to the target. Additionally, if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet away from you and knocked prone.
Lightning and thunder damage you deal bypasses resistance, and immunity only halves the damage. Creatures cannot benefit from the Lightning Absorption trait from damage you deal.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Traditions
entries: Those whom swear the Oath of Traditions recognize the value of history, of lore, of the past. Called knight-chroniclers or yoreguards by some, these paladins are protectors of traditional institutions as well as keepers of those stories that would otherwise be forgotten, be it the grand epic of a dead empire, recorded on but one surviving manuscript, or the joyful memories of an elder recollecting the first harvest festival of a village no longer so young.

These paladins can be found in service to gods of home and civilization, such as Parash or Eudico, under the authority of grand archives and keepers of history, or in temples and shrines dedicated to the remembrance and veneration of deceased ancestry. Many can be found questing through the world in search for stories that would otherwise be forgotten. Others travel in order to stand in opposition to forces that threaten to destroy what came before.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Traditions
entries: The chaotic nature of Traditions makes some question the necessity or legitimacy of these tenets, but nevertheless these are the words that have been passed down for countless generations by warriors who have lived and died by them.

entries.name: Heritage.
entries: Carry on the old traditions, yesterday's way of life, connecting the past to the present and enlivening both.

entries.name: Remembrance.
entries: Write the stories of people and cultures and places upon both crude matter and upon your mind. By remembering these tales, that which is gone yet lives.

entries.name: Joy.
entries: Celebrate successful preservation, revel in surviving legends, and savor traditions still observed. When heritage is respected, all become part of something more.

entries.name: Sorrow.
entries: When history is lost, when stories are forgotten, when cultures die, and when traditions are trampled, weep. Mourn ancient beauty and horror alike, for it mattered.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Turn Machination.
entries: As an action, you use your Channel Divinity to abjure fabricated locomotion. Each construct or undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

entries.name: Invoke Legacy.
entries: You call upon the spirits of those who have passed, using your Channel Divinity. As an action, choose a number of creatures up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature) that you can see within 60 feet of you. Each creature gains advantage on the next ability check or attack roll it makes within 1 minute.
Alternatively, you can touch one creature as an action and grant it advantage on Intelligence (History) checks for the next 10 minutes.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Reverence
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your presence wards against desecration and decay. Dead creatures within 10 feet of you cannot be reanimated as undead, and written material cannot be destroyed unless you permit it. Additionally, whenever you or a friendly creature within 10 feet of you takes necrotic damage, you can use your reaction to grant that creature resistance to that instance of damage.
At 18th level, the range of this aura increases to 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: The Old Ways
entries: At 15th level, your connection to the past deepens, making your frame as firm as the earth. You gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws. You also can read all writing and can perfectly recall any creature's name that you learn.

subclassFeature.name: Bridge to the Past
entries: Beginning at 20th level, you can use your action to channel the legacy of history. For 1 minute, you are surrounded by spirit beings who confer the following benefits:

items: You can touch and make melee attacks against creatures within 30 feet of you.
You can make a single weapon attack as a bonus action.
You gain the benefit of three-quarters cover against all ranged attacks targeting you.
Spaces within 30 feet of you are considered difficult terrain for creatures of your choosing.

entries: After using this feature, you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Radiance
entries: The Oath of Radiance is almost as old as the sun that it follows, and has remained a steady force of good over the ages. Often called sun warriors or shining knights, paladins that take this oath seek to bring light and knowledge to even the darkest areas of the world. Some of them adorn their armor with dazzling inlaid glass and brilliantly bright metals, so that they can reflect the sun's glory and become physical beacons on the battlefield. They also might wear images of the sun or stars — the holy lights that bring life and knowledge to this world, and reveal all that is hidden by shadows and darkness. Like a star in the night, a paladin of the Oath of Radiance seeks to be a light of truth in the dark.

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Radiance
entries: The chaotic nature of Radiance makes some question the necessity or legitimacy of these tenets, but nevertheless these are the words that have been passed down for countless generations by warriors who have lived and died by them.

entries.name: Truth.
entries: Like a light in the dark, you must reveal the truth when it is shrouded in mystery.

entries.name: Leadership.
entries: You must become a beacon of light that everyone else follows, and lead others along the right path.

entries.name: Preservation.
entries: Where the light glows strongest, you must be ready to stand in its defense.

entries.name: Knowledge.
entries: Those that are ignorant to the truth must be shown the light. Spread your knowledge to all those that would accept it.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity
entries: When you take this oath at 3rd level, you gain the following two Channel Divinity options.

entries.name: Blinding Intervention.
entries: As an action, you can use your Channel Divinity to teleport to an unoccupied location within 5 feet of a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. That creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become blinded for up to 1 minute. The creature can repeat this save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Additionally, other creatures of your choice within 5 feet of you after you teleport must also make Constitution saving throws. On a failed save, a creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Divine Sunlight.
entries: You can use your Channel Divinity to exude an aura of light. As an action, you can cause your body to emit bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light 10 feet beyond that for 1 minute. This light is sunlight, and reveals the true form of shapechangers and creatures altered through magic.
Fey, fiends, and undead within the bright light have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than you. Additionally, magical darkness does not function within the area of bright light.
Once you reach 7th level, the radius of the bright light increases to 20 feet, with dim light extending 20 feet beyond that.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Light
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can choose to emit an aura of light while you're not incapacitated. The aura extends 10 feet from you in every direction, but not through total cover, and its area is bright light. Dim light extends 10 feet beyond this, but the dim light is not considered part of the aura. You and friendly creatures within the aura have resistance to radiant and necrotic damage, and advantage on death saving throws.

You can activate and deactivate this aura as a bonus action. Starting at 18th level, you can also use your bonus action to increase this aura's range to 30 feet, or reduce it back to 10 feet. The dim light also changes by the same amount.

subclassFeature.name: All-Seeing
entries: Beginning at 15th level, you are always under the effects of a see invisibility spell. Additionally, for you see invisibility now has a range of 30 feet, rather than self, allowing you to grant its effects to another creature within range when you cast it.

subclassFeature.name: Radiant Champion
entries: At 20th level, you gain the ability to harness radiant energy and become a paragon of light. Using your action, you undergo a transformation. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

items: On your turn, you can spend your movement to teleport a distance equal to twice the movement you spend. You must teleport to an unoccupied location that you can see.

When you hit a creature with an attack, it takes an additional 1d8 radiant damage and is basked in radiant energy until the start of your next turn. For the duration, the creature can't benefit from being invisible, attacks made against it are made with advantage, and it emits dim light out to a range of 10 feet.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Mage
entries: Your blood contains a potent cocktail of magical energies which you draw upon to create incredible effects. Those born under a blood moon are particularly likely to be gifted with this power. For that reason some consider it an ill omen to be born on such nights, while others strive for it.

subclassFeature.name: Scarlet Magic
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Scarlet Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be an enchantment or a necromancy spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Imbrued Blood
entries: When you choose this origin at 1st level, your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 again whenever you gain a level in this class.
Additionally, you gain an additional amount of hit dice equal to your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Crimson
entries: Also at 1st level, you gain the ability to spend hit dice as an action on your turn, rolling the hit dice up to a number equal to your proficiency bonus, and regaining health as though you had finished a short rest.
Additionally, you can use your own blood as a spellcasting focus.

subclassFeature.name: Black Arts
entries: At 6th level, you can enter a sacrificial state called the "dreering" as a bonus action. The dreering lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. While dreering you may cast spells of 1st-level or higher using your arcane blood instead of spell slots. You are only able to cast spells in this way of a level up to half the highest level of spell slot you have.
For example if you are a 13th level sorcerer, you can cast spells using your crimson that are of 3rd level or lower.

Every time you cast a spell in this way, roll a number of d8s equal to the spell's level. Add the dice together and reduce your current and maximum hit points by the result. The reduction of your maximum hit points lasts until the next dawn.
Whenever you cast a spell using this feature and you roll damage for the spell, you can reroll any roll of 1 on the damage dice, but you must use the new roll.
If you become unconscious while dreering, the effects of this feature cease to work until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Stained Grave
entries: At 14th level, you are immune to disease and poison and become harder to destroy due to your arcane blood. When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to spend a hit die, rolling it. If the result is above a 3, you are brought to 1 hit point instead and regain hit points equal to twice the number rolled plus your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Shift of Ichor
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can syphon the blood from creatures around you, creating a temporary shield around your body. As an action you may pull the crimson out of creatures within a 20-foot-sphere around you. You may choose a number of creatures equal to 2 + your Charisma modifier. Each selected creature must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure a creature takes 3d12 necrotic damage, or half as much on a successful one.
For each creature that failed the saving throw you gain 1d10 temporary hit points.
You regain the use of this ability when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Dreamwalker
entries: You have had vivid dreams ever since you were a small child -- dreams that are indistinguishable from reality and can even influence it. As you grew older you gained knowledge of the place you visit every time you slumber. A realm between realms and a world between worlds called the Dreaming.

It is a place of pure magic where the dreams of mortals and immortals alike become reality. A beautiful garden dreamt by an herbalist physically manifests in this realm but with this comes a grave danger. When a creature dreams of a nightmare, it enters the Dreaming and runs loose until the individual wakes up.

To stop these rampages, there lives a race of beings called the Novori, not quite material but not quite spirit beings. They safeguard the Dreaming (as they call it), and when the threat of a Nightmare is not imminent, they sweeten the dreams of good-hearted individuals.

There are times however, when the Novori have to send ambassadors to the physical realms to stop a frightening event from happening, before it can infest the dreams of mortals. These ambassadors however, tainted by the energies of the Plane they were sent to, cannot return to the Dreaming and must become accustomed to living as a physical being.
These Novori form a rare bloodline among mortals, whose offspring sometimes gain the power to enter the Dreaming in their sleep. You are one of these select few.

subclassFeature.name: Sorcery of the Dreaming
entries: As you delve into and examine the dreams of yours and others, you gradually gain more and more influence over the Dreaming, allowing you to harness its magical energy.

You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Dreaming Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be a conjuration or a divination spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Dream Voyager
entries: When you choose this origin at 1st level, your immense experience within the realm of dreams allows you to more easily coax those of the waking world into sleep. Whenever you cast the sleep spell, you may ignore the verbal and somatic components of the spell and its die size is increased from a d8 to a d10. At 14th level, this increases to a d12. You can also choose to maintain concentration on the magical sleep to increase its duration to up to 1 hour.

Additionally, you can cast detect thoughts once per long rest without expending a spell slot. When cast it in this way, the target must be an unconscious individual, but they will be unaware of the spell's effects.

subclassFeature.name: Lucid Dreams
entries: At 6th level, you have mastered the ability to bolster yourself within your lucid dreams. You have also learned to help the willing into a state of slumber, should it not come easily to them.

Whenever you finish a long rest, choose one of the dream options below. Your choice reflects the topic and effects of the lucid dream you experienced while asleep. Until you finish another long rest, you gain the benefits listed that correspond with the dream you chose:

entries.name: Worldly.
entries: You have spent your lucid dream traveling to potential realities, learning about various cultures that could possibly exist, and interacting with far off places and strange realities. You have learned much and feel inspired to take on the day. You are proficient in Intelligence saving throws and gain proficiency in two different skills that use Intelligence, and you are not already proficient in.

entries.name: Reactive.
entries: You have spent your dream in the throes of combat. When you wake, you have an acute sense of how your body works and a greater ability to avoid taking unnecessary damage. You are proficient with Dexterity saving throws and gain proficiency with Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) if you don't already have it.

entries.name: Pensive.
entries: You have spent your lucid dream in deep reflection and contemplation about the nature of the world, magic, and your place in it. You are proficient in Wisdom saving throws and gain proficiency in Wisdom (Insight) if you do not already have it.

subclassFeature.name: Slumbering Nightmare
entries: Starting at 14th level, you have attuned yourself to the will of the nightmares who sometimes visit your dreams and can rally them to your side to harm dreamers nearby.

As an action, you may cause any creature within 60 feet of you that you can see to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, all targets fall unconscious. Creatures who fall unconscious from this ability wake up after 1 hour or immediately if they suffer damage from any source. Once you use this ability you must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

Additionally, whenever an unconscious creature you can see would be dealt damage, you may use your reaction to expend up to 5 sorcery points. For each sorcery point spent, the target suffers an additional 1d8 psychic damage as it is tormented by horrible nightmares.

subclassFeature.name: The Awoken Dream
entries: At 18th level, you have become a being of waking dreams, fully embracing your Novori heritage, and never truly awake or asleep. You gain the following benefits:

items: You no longer need to sleep to gain the benefits of a long rest.
You may choose to change the bolstering effect granted to you by your Lucid Dreams feature at any time by spending 2 sorcery points and one minute in meditation.

You know the imprisonment spell, though you may only cast it using its Slumber effect. It is a sorcerer spell for you and doesn't count against your number of spells known. You can have up to five simultaneous instances of the Slumber effect of imprisonment active at a time. If you cast the spell on a new target while you have five instances in effect, the oldest spell ends.

subclassFeature.name: Fey-Touched
entries: The innate magic you possess comes from some mingling of Feywild magic into your bloodline. Your ancestors may have bargained with powerful fey, or spent too long living in the Feywild. A trickster fey may even have taken you as a child and placed a spell upon you. Whatever the case, you have been given a variety of faerie magic to wield as your own.

subclassFeature.name: Faerie Court
entries: Your magical abilities originate with one of the Feywild's faerie courts: Autumn, Spring, Summer, or Winter, each representing different personalities, philosophies, and appearances based on the state of the world during their respective seasons. At 1st level, you learn to speak, read and write Sylvan and you choose which court you are aligned with, gaining one of the following proficiencies depending on your court:

subclassFeature.name: Court Magic
entries: Your magic originates from your court, granting you knowledge of certain spells. You learn additional spells linked to that court when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in their respective Court Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be an enchantment or an illusion spell from the bard, druid or sorcerer spell list.

entries.caption: Autumn Court Spells
rows: {@spell hex|PHB}, {@spell ray of sickness|PHB},{@spell rotting gaze|Hergard}

entries.caption: Spring Court Spells
rows: {@spell cure wounds|phb}, {@spell goodberry|PHB},{@spell spare the dying|PHB}
{@spell aura of life|PHB}, {@spell conjure woodland beings|PHB}

entries.caption: Summer Court Spells
rows: {@spell faerie fire|PHB}, {@spell hellish rebuke|PHB},{@spell gleaming arrow|Hergard}

entries.caption: Winter Court Spells
rows: {@spell protection from evil and good|PHB}, {@spell sanctuary|PHB},{@spell purge|Hergard}
{@spell aura of purity|phb}, {@spell Otiluke's resilient sphere|PHB}
{@spell circle of power|PHB}, {@spell dispel evil and good|PHB}

subclassFeature.name: Illusory Movement
entries: At 6th level, your innate talent for illusion magic begins to blossom. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher on your turn, you can use your bonus action to become invisible until the beginning of your next turn.
Once you use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Knowledge of the Courts
entries: At 14th level, you undergo significant growth within your court, gaining knowledge of your own innate magic. You gain one of the following abilities depending on your court:

entries.name: Autumn's Rot.
entries: Your mere presence fills your surroundings with death and decay, and your magic makes your influence more powerful. As an action on your turn, you can spend 4 sorcery points to conjure a garden of rot around you. The garden manifests as a 20-foot radius around you for 1 minute. Any nonmagical plant in the area that isn't a creature, such as a tree or shrub, withers and dies. When you cast a spell that deals necrotic or poison damage while in the area, and you roll a 1 on any damage die, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll, even if the new roll is a 1. When the creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3d6 necrotic damage and suffer one level of exhaustion. Any levels of exhaustion caused by the garden fade when the garden disappears.

entries.name: Spring's Bounty.
entries: You can conjure a lush feast of food and drink akin to celebrations of the fey. As an action on your turn, you can spend 4 sorcery points to cast heroes' feast without material components. When you cast this spell, you can designate a number of creatures equal to your sorcerer level to be exempt from its positive effects and instead if they eat or drink from the feast be forced to succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer Spell save DC or be charmed by you for 1 hour. This effect ends if the creature is harmed by you or your allies.

entries.name: Summer's Warmth.
entries: You harbor a fierce spirit within you, and you can embolden it when the need arises. As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 4 sorcery points to grant yourself the following benefits for up to 1 hour:

items: You gain resistance to cold damage and immunity to fire damage
Your speed increases by 10 feet
You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet
Allied creatures visible to you within 30 feet are immune to the effects of extreme cold and gain advantage on saving throws made to resist charm and fear effects

entries.name: Winter's Serenity.
entries: You exude a serene aura that you can empower with your magic. As an action on your turn you can spend 4 sorcery points to send out a pacifying wave of fey magic in a 60-foot radius. Each creature of your choice in that area that you can see, must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your sorcerer Spell save DC, or drop any weapons it is holding, end its concentration on any spells or other effects, and become charmed by you for 1 minute. The charmed creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, it makes saves against this feature with advantage until next dawn.

subclassFeature.name: Bridge to the Fey
entries: At 18th level, your fey powers manifested fully, and your powerful magic allows you to create bridges between the material plane and the Feywild.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Bridge
entries: As an action on your turn you can call fey creatures to your aid. You summon a fey creature of a challenge rating equal to half your sorcerer level (rounded down) or lower. It appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within 90 feet. The fey creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points.

The fey creature is friendly to you and your companions for 1 hour. Roll initiative for the creature, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it or defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions if none are issued. After 1 hour, the fey creature disappears.

If the creature isn't aligned with your court or your commands violate its alignment, it can attempt to make a Charisma saving throw against your sorcerer Spell save DC with disadvantage at the end of each of its turns. On a success, you lose control of the creature.
Once you use this feature you must finish a long rest before you can use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Major Bridge
entries: You can use interplanar magic along with a powerful ritual to link the area around you to the realm of the fey. If you are within a forest, you can spend 4 hours conducting a ritual to bridge that forest to the Feywild. All forested area within 1 mile of the ritual are linked to the Feywild for 24 hours. If you conduct this ritual in the same area every day for three months, its effect last permanently, or until it is dispelled by a 9th level dispel magic, or wish spell.

items: The appearance of the forest changes to suit your court. An Autumn Court Sorcerer could create a forest that reflects the Feywild's dark and cold corners, while one of the Spring Court would be colorful and filled with a bounty of fruit and plants.

The magic of this forest flows freely, making it hard to navigate. Creatures who attempt to travel through this forest must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Spell save DC or become magically lost. If you are within the forest, you know the location of any foreign creatures within it. If a creature becomes magically lost, you can choose to alter illusory paths and guide it to any location within the forest as long as it continues to travel. You can do this from anywhere within the forest. When conducting the ritual and any time afterwards, you can choose any number of creatures to be exempt from this effect.
All spells of the enchantment and illusion schools cast while within this forest are empowered. Saves made to resist their effects are always made with disadvantage.

Lesser fey creatures flock to this new and different location, assisting you at your call. Once each day as an action, you can summon 1d12 sprites, 1d12 pixies, 1d10 darklings or 1d8 quicklings, each of which will obey your every command for 24 hours. These fey can leave the forest, but will always return after 24 hours.

entries: You can only have one forest affected in this way at any given time.

subclassFeature.name: Flametouched
entries: Your magic stems from the primordial energy of elemental fire. Many sorcerers with this power can trace their ancestry to the creatures of the Plane of Elemental fire, particularly the Efreeti. This origin is not always ancestral, however. Your powers might have manifested after a near-death experience with a creature of fire, like the legendary phoenix, or simply through constant exposure to fire. In rare cases, those that live near volcanoes can spontaneously gain these powers, especially if they've lived near one since childhood. Regardless of how this magic manifested, it causes flames to permeate your soul and define your magic.

subclassFeature.name: Fire Within
entries: Your inner flame grants you aptitude in all forms of pyromancy. When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn or replace a sorcerer spell, you can choose the new spell from any spell list if the chosen spell deals fire damage. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Ember Magic
entries: Starting at 1st level, you can cause your fire magic to leave behind magical embers in its wake. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, you can conjure a cloud of embers that fills a 10-foot radius extending out from your body. Alternatively, if the spell you cast has an area of effect (such as burning hands or fireball), you can choose to have the cloud cover the area of the spell, rather than manifest around you. Either way, the cloud remains in the place it was conjured, and lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it. The area of the cloud is lightly obscured, and you gain the following benefits while you are within a cloud conjured by this feature:

items: As a bonus action, you can teleport up to 15 feet to a point you can see within a cloud. You cannot use this action if your speed is 0, and you cannot cast a spell during the same turn unless that spell is a cantrip with a casting time of 1 action.
Opportunity attacks made by other creatures within the cloud have disadvantage against you.
You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by the cloud.

subclassFeature.name: Fleeting Flames
entries: At 6th level, your magic begins to rekindle your spirit. When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, your speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the turn. This speed bonus is increased to 20 feet at 14th level, and 30 feet at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Ashen Inferno
entries: Also at 6th level, you learn how to reignite your conjured embers to burn your foes. Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage and has an area of effect that intersects with one or more of the clouds of embers conjured with your Ember Magic feature, you can spend 1 sorcery point to cause the spell's effect to spread throughout the connected clouds, allowing it to affect more creatures.

Creatures of your choice within the connected clouds are affected by the spell as if they were within the spell's normal area. Also, any creature within the area of intersection between the spelland the clouds takes additional damage equal to the spell's level. You cannot use your Ember Magic feature on the same turn you use Ashen Inferno.
The sorcery point cost is increased to 2 if you use this feature on a spell of 3rd or 4th level, 3 for a spell of 5th or 6th level, and 4 for a spell of 7th level or higher.

subclassFeature.name: Enkindled Body
entries: At 14th level, you become one with your inner flame. You gain resistance to fire damage, and your Ember Magic feature is improved. When you activate that feature, you can create two clouds at once: one that extends out from you, and one that covers the spell's area of effect. If the spell you cast doesn't have an area of effect, you create one cloud that fills a 20-foot radius extending out from your body, rather than the normal 10-foot radius cloud. Additionally, the distance you can teleport within these clouds is increased to 60 feet. This teleportation also no longer restricts your spellcasting, and can be used when your speed is 0.

subclassFeature.name: Ascendant Flame
entries: Starting at 18th level, you can use your bonus action to transform yourself into a fiery form until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). While this feature lasts, you are immune to fire damage, have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and any creature that touches you or hits you with a melee weapon attack while within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to half your sorcerer level.

subclassFeature.name: Orchard Origin
entries: Your magic is tied to the beauty and elegance of nature. Perhaps you obtained your magic from a mystical dryad, or instead stumbled across an ancient forest ritual. No matter how you obtained it, you're able to reflect this beauty in the flowers you create to protect your allies.

subclassFeature.name: One with Nature
entries: Your link to mother nature allows you to learn spells normally associated with the druid class. When your Spellcasting feature lets you learn or replace a sorcerer cantrip or a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose the new spell from the druid spell list or the sorcerer spell list. You must otherwise obey all the restrictions for selecting the spell, and it becomes a sorcerer spell for you.

In addition, choose a biome of nature your powers are most associate with: forest, grassland, swamp, jungle or the fey. You learn an additional spell based on that association, as shown below. It is a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against your number of sorcerer spells known. If you later replace this spell, you must replace it with a spell from the druid spell list.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Bloom
entries: Starting when you choose this origin at 1st level, your spells call forth the vibrant natural energy of flowers. You learn the druidcraft cantrip, which doesn't count against your number of sorcerer cantrips known. It is considered a sorcerer spell for you.

Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, you can summon a cluster of magical flowers that bloom across your own armour or clothing or that of a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see. You select which type of flowers bloom, with the chosen type of flowers granting their listed benefit to the creature:

entries.name: Chamomile.
entries: These small white flowers embody speed. The creature can add 1d4 to its Dexterity checks, and its movement speed increases by 5 feet.

entries.name: Dandelion.
entries: These small yellow flowers stand for hope. The creature has advantage on death saving throws.

entries.name: Lavender.
entries: These lavender flowers symbolize power. The creature's weapon attacks count as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

entries.name: Lily.
entries: These flowers, often white or pink, personify honor. The creature has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Sunflower.
entries: These bright yellow flowers reflect the sun, and inspire vitality. The creature has advantage on saving throws against poison and disease.
The flowers last for 1 minute, and a creature can only benefit from one type of flower growing on it at a time; if a new type of flower is grown on a creature, the previous flowers wither and die.

subclassFeature.name: Swirl of Petals
entries: At 6th level, you can twist your natural magics to better protect your allies. As a bonus action on your turn, you can cause petals to swirl up and around a creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Until the start of your next turn, attack rolls against that creature have disadvantage.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again.

subclassFeature.name: Exhilarating Bloom
entries: Starting at 14th level, you've unlocked the capabilities to summon new and powerful flowers. Whenever you summon flowers on a creature, you can choose to instead spend 2 sorcery points to select one of the following flower types to summon:

entries.name: Camellia.
entries: These large pink flowers represent resilience. When you grow these flowers on a creature, they can choose one of the following damage types: cold, fire, or lightning. When the creature take damage of that type, they can reduce the damage they take by an amount equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Gerbera.
entries: These brightly coloured flowers express strength. When the creature rolls damage and rolls a 1 or 2 on any of the dice, it can choose to reroll one of them. The creature must use the new result.

entries.name: Marigold.
entries: These golden flowers typify cruelty. Whenever the creature reduces another creature to 0 hit points, it gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d6 + your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Pansy.
entries: These flowers, often purple or yellow, express loyalty. The creature, and all friendly creatures within 5 feet of them, have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

entries.name: Stephanotis.
entries: These small white flowers inspire luck. When the creature rolls a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, it can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

subclassFeature.name: Reverberating Bloom
entries: Starting at 18th level, when your flowers bloom, they do so abundantly. When you grow flowers on a creature, you can spend 3 sorcery points to grow the same type of flowers on any number of creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the first creature.

Additionally, when you grow a flower on yourself using either your Inspiring Bloom or your Exhilarating Bloom, any previous flowers do not immediately wither and die, but instead last for their full duration.

subclassFeature.name: Oracle Bloodline
entries: You hail from a long line of oracles, once gifted with the spark of magic to help guide the living and the dead of the world who lost their path. Though able to do magic of all kind, your ancestors perfected their powers to see the future in ways a commoner couldn't even dream of. Through concentration you can see all parallel timelines and every possibility of an individual's every move, aiding you in combat and in society.

subclassFeature.name: Diviner's Sorcery
entries: You learn additional spells when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown on the Prophetic Spells table. Each of these spells counts as a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against the number of sorcerer spells you know.

Whenever you gain a sorcerer level, you can replace one spell you gained from this feature with another spell of the same level. The new spell must be an abjuration or a divination spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list.

Any spell that might require a god or otherworldly being, you contact the spirits of the Ethereal realm instead. They answer normally as an entity would, though their knowledge might be more limited than a god's (at the DM's discretion).

entries.caption: Prophetic Spells
rows: {@spell detect evil and good|PHB}, {@spell identify|PHB},{@spell guidance|PHB}

subclassFeature.name: Clairvoyant Combatant
entries: Starting at 1st level, you gain insight into your enemy's next move.

If a hostile creature makes a weapon attack against you, you may use your reaction to roll 1d4 and subtract it from the attack roll. If the attack misses you, the attacker can't make opportunity attacks against you until the start of your next turn. At 14th level, the rolled die improves to 2d4.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Rituals of the Diviner
entries: At 1st level, you can cast any sorcerer spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

Additionally, you may learn one first level spell that has the ritual tag. It is a sorcerer spell for you, but it doesn't count against your number of sorcerer spells known. If you later replace this spell, you must replace it with a spell that has the ritual tag.

subclassFeature.name: Foresight
entries: At 6th level, your foreseeing powers aid you in dire situations.

Whenever you fail a saving throw by a number equal or less than your proficiency bonus, you may glance into your own future to foresee and avoid the danger, instead succeeding on the save. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Additionally, if you are surprised at the beginning of combat and aren't incapacitated, you can act normally on

subclassFeature.name: Trained mind
entries: Beginning at 14th level, your long past of using your mind to see into other timelines has trained it to better concentrate on magic.

If you are already concentrating on a spell, you may spend 4 sorcery points before casting a different spell that requires concentration. In doing so, you may hold both concentration spells for up to half their normal duration, but you cannot cast any other spells for the time. While concentrating on both spells you have disadvantage on concentration checks. You may end concentration on either one of these spells at will and cast spells as normal, but the already changed duration doesn't revert.

subclassFeature.name: Divinium Arcana
entries: Starting at 18th level, your divining powers fully manifest, simultaneously seeing into multiple creatures' futures.

Whenever a creature within 30 feet of you is targeted by an attack or is forced to make a saving throw, you can use your reaction to aid them in avoiding danger. If the creature was targeted by an attack, you force the attacking creature to reroll the attack, using a d12 instead of a d20 for the attack roll. If the creature was forced to make a saving throw, it can add a d12 to its saving throw. If the creature was subjected to an effect that allows them to make a saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the save.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Noble Genie
entries: Emerging out of a fusion between a mortal soul and pure elemental energy, genies are creatures of legend and wonder. The most powerful among them are the noble genies, rivaled in their power only by gods, unrivaled in their arrogance and decadence.

You have made a pact with one such entity, dao, djinni, efreeti, or marid. Perhaps you were one of their former slaves turned agent of their will, or your pact is a result of a genie wish gone awry. A noble genie often employs the service of a warlock to expand their influence beyond their domain on one of the elemental planes, to attain what even their reality-bending powers fail to achieve.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Noble Genie lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Noble Genie Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell create food and water|PHB}, {@spell lightning bolt|PHB}

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Essence
entries: At 1st level, your patron imbues you with the elemental essence of its home plane. Select one of the genie types from the Elemental Essence table. You learn the Primordial dialect and spells associated with your choice, as shown in the table. These spells count as warlock spells for you, but they don't count against your number of warlock spells known.
When you cast a spell granted by this feature using a warlock spell slot, the spell slot you expend counts as a spell slot of one level higher.
This number increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to two levels at 6th level, three levels at 10th level, and four levels at 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Ascent
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use a bonus action on your turn to transform your lower body into a whirling cloud of elemental energy. You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed until the end of your next turn. During this time, you also gain a benefit associated with the genie type you chose with your Primordial Essence feature.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Dao.
entries: Your lower body becomes a column of swirling sand. You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

entries.name: Djinni.
entries: Your lower body becomes a column of swirling air. Your flying speed increases by 10 feet, and your movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

entries.name: Efreeti.
entries: Your lower body becomes a column of smoke and embers. Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of you or enters the same area for the first time on a turn takes fire damage equal to half your warlock level.

entries.name: Marid.
entries: Your lower body becomes a column of foamy water. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed and you can move through the space of other creatures. Once on each of your turns, you can knock a Large or smaller creature prone when you move through its space.

subclassFeature.name: Eternal Ascent
entries: Starting at 10th level, you regain the use of your Elemental Ascent feature whenever you cast one of your Primordial Essence spells using a warlock spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Wishful Debt
entries: Starting at 14th level, your patron allows you to call in favors from other genies indebted to it. As an action, you can summon a Dao, Djinni, Efreeti, or Marid (your DM's choice), which appears in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you.

The genie is indifferent towards you and your companions. Roll initiative for the genie, which has its own turns. You can use an action to request a course of activity from the genie. The genie uses its action on its next turn to follow the request in the most literal terms possible. If you don't issue any requests to the genie, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions. You can issue up to three requests from the genie this way.
The genie disappears after 10 minutes, when it drops to 0 hit points, or after it has attempted to follow your third request.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Quiet One
entries: You have made a pact with a pacifist water entity. This creature lent you their power to protect the ones in need and help people see the peaceful side of the tides by controlling the very lifeblood of the realms: water.
The peace-loving nature of your patron has an influence on your emotions too. You become more careful not to hurt your foes unnecessarily, leading you on a path to aid and protect, rather than harm.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Quiet One lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

entries.caption: Quiet One Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell cure wounds|PHB}, {@spell create or destroy water|PHB}

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you learn the shape water and mending cantrips. They count as warlock cantrips for you, but they don't count against your number of cantrips known.

subclassFeature.name: Calming Presence
entries: Also at 1st level, due to your peaceful nature, you gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill. If you are already proficient, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses this skill.

Additionally, you may cast calm emotions a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) without expending a spell slot and only requiring verbal components, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blessing of the Waves
entries: Starting at 6th level, your patron aids you in battle. You gain resistance to fire damage and magical damage from water based spells.

Additionally, whenever you or a creature within 15 feet of you is dealt damage, you may use your reaction to grant them resistance to the triggering damage type until the start of your next turn. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ebb and Flow
entries: At 10th level, as an action, you may present your spellcasting focus, evoking the powers of the changing waves. A surge of spiritual water bursts out from your focus, healing those in need and harming those who seek to hurt you.
You may choose a number of creatures to be effected by the waves, equal to your warlock level in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on you.
Revitalizing waters aid friendly creatures' injuries. You divide hitpoints equal to twice your warlock level between the chosen creatures to be healed by.

Raging tide crashes down upon your enemies. Chosen targets must make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, they are pushed to the edge of the 15-foot-radius around you. On a successful save, the creature is only pushed back 5 feet.
You regain the use of this feature after finishing a long rest or by expending a warlock spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Sea
entries: At 14th level, you reach the peak of your aquatic powers, letting loose your protective water magic. As an action, you conjure spheres of water that spin around you harmlessly that last for 1 minute. The number of spheres is equal to 2 + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

Whenever a hostile creature makes a melee weapon attack against one of your allies within 30 feet that you can see, you can use your reaction to hurl one of the orbs against them, expending it. As your watery fury slams into them, they must succeed on a Strength saving throw or their attack is wasted and they are pushed back 15 feet.

If there is a natural body of water within 30 feet of you, the waves empower your orbs, giving any enemy that doesn't have a swimming speed disadvantage on the saving throw. You regain the use of this feature when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Sweetstress
entries: You have forged a pact with a Sweetstress, ancient, kind beings that dedicated their existence to sweetening the lives of others. They often appear to people in the guise of a sweet elderly woman, and those who take their patronage forge a contract to spread joy to everyone they meet.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Sweetstress lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells count as warlock spells for you.

entries.caption: Sweetstress Expanded Spells
rows: {@spell create food and water|phb}, {@spell tiny servant|xge}
{@spell aura of life|PHB}, {@spell otiluke's resilient sphere|phb}

subclassFeature.name: Sugar Rush
entries: Starting at 1st level, when you expend a spell slot of 1st level or higher, you gain a sudden burst of energy. Until the start of your next turn, your movement speed is doubled, and you gain an extra action this turn, which you can use to take any action other than Attack or Cast a Spell.

subclassFeature.name: Sweet Tooth
entries: From 6th level, you learn how to magically create sweets that can bolster those who consume them. As an action, you can create a magical candy that manifests in your hand, a gift from The Sweetstress herself. This candy can be consumed by a creature as a bonus action. When you create this candy, choose one of the following types to create:

entries.name: Brighteye Bean.
entries: A small, black jelly bean with cobalt blue speckles. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Investigation and Perception checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Charming Chocolate.
entries: A large, deep brown disc of chocolate that seems to emit a faint golden glow. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Persuasion and Performance checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Muscle Mint.
entries: A small, green and white swirled ball of mint with a print of a curled bicep on it. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Athletics and Acrobatics checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Sly Sour.
entries: A long, orange-red roll of sugar-coated sour lolly that makes no sound as you chew it. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Stealth and Sleight of Hand checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Knowing Nougat.
entries: . A large, pale brown slab of candy with bright silver nuts scattered throughout. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Insight and History checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Magic Marshmallow.
entries: A deep blue marshmallow with star-like white dots covering it. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Arcana and Religion checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Grove Gumball.
entries: A verdant green gumball candy with the design of a leaf printed on it. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Nature and Animal Handling checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Wild Warhead.
entries: A compact, green and brown coloured hard candy with an incredibly sour taste. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Survival and Medicine checks for the next minute.

entries.name: Faker's Fudge.
entries: A pale white fudge with the golden sigil of a devil's tongue on the top. Consuming this candy grants you advantage on Deception and Intimidation checks for the next minute.
When you finish a long rest, any uneaten candies you created disappear.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. You regain all expended uses of this ability when you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Shared Enthusiasm
entries: From 10th level, your childlike energy is contagious, and others near you share in its intensity. When you use the Sugar Rush feature, you can also grant its benefits to another creature of your choice within 30 feet of you.

subclassFeature.name: Bittersweet
entries: At 14th level, your patron grants you the power to hamper those who would harm your allies with spolied sweets. When you deal damage with a Warlock spell, the target(s) must make a Constitution saving throw against your Spell Save DC or become poisoned for 1 minute, taking 1d8 poison damage at the start of each of their turns while poisoned in this way. The target can re-attempt this saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.
Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Wicked Crone
entries: You made a deal with a powerful hag in order to get magical powers, perhaps an auntie, a grandmother or a legendary hag like Baba Yaga. Maybe she tricked you into accepting, maybe you did it voluntarily, but one thing is certain: she will expect payment in return, whatever it is. Until then, you get to exercise some of her powers and innate abilities, including bargaining skills, mysterious black magic and a weird charming prowess.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The Wicked Crone lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Ritual casting
entries: At 1st level, you learn how to cast certain spells as rituals. You can cast a warlock spell you know as a ritual as long as the spell has the ritual tag.

subclassFeature.name: Sinister Sneer
