entries: At 1st level, you learn tricks that your patron uses to deceive mortals and to instill fear and doubt in its enemies.
You gain proficiency in the Deception skill and double your proficiency bonus for it. This bonus does not stack with bonuses from similar features, like Expertise.

Additionally, whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that targets an hostile creature, you can use a bonus action to force the target to make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, it has disadvantage on attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn. A creature immediately succeeds on the saving throw if it is immune to the charmed condition.

subclassFeature.name: Respect Your Elders
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can blur the eyes and confuse the minds of your enemies, making them attack their own friends.

When you are targeted by an attack or spell, you can choose a hostile creature you can see within the range of the attack and then use your reaction to force the attacker to make a Wisdom saving throw. If it fails, the chosen creature becomes the new target of the attack. If the attacker has disadvantage to the attack against you because of Sinister Sneer, it automatically fails the saving throw, while if it is immune to the charmed condition, it automatically succeeds.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum 1), and you regain all expended charges after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bad Taste
entries: Starting at 10th level, you develop an unusual curiosity for weird and unique objects and charms.

You add identify to the list of spells you know and it counts as a warlock spell for you. Also, you can spend one hour during a long rest to create an object infused with a warlock spell you know with a cast duration of one action. If you use an action to destroy the item, you can cast the spell infused within without expending a spell slot. You can only have a number of items created this way equal to half your Charisma modifier, rounded down (minimum 1). If an item is not used within the same day it is created, it loses its magical properties.

subclassFeature.name: Grandma's Recipe
entries: Starting at 14th level, your patron decides to share a powerful secret with you. You learn how to submit to your will those foolish enough to accept to make a deal with you.

You can create a special potion with your Bad Taste feature. If any creature drinks it, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a fail, it suffers the effect of a true polymorph spell, but it retains the ability to speak and its mental ability scores. If the creature is unconscious when it drinks the potion, it automatically fails the saving throw. The creature is under your control as if under the effect of a dominate beast, dominate person or dominate monster spell, accordingly to its type, and you don't need to maintain concentration to control it. The effect lasts until you dismiss the servant or until you die. You can have only one creature under your control at any given time.
Once a creature succeeds the saving throw or is dismissed, it can't be affected again by the effects of the potion for a month, unless it chooses to do so willingly.

subclassFeature.name: The World Tree
entries: Your patron is a tree of a size and age beyond comprehension, whose roots reach across the planes, space and even time itself. As an agent of this ancient force, your charge is to preserve life and foster the never-ending balance of life and death, bolstering the meek who need a chance to thrive, and patiently eroding the structures of power in the world that stifle growth.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: The World Tree lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a warlock spell. The following spells are added to the warlock spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: In Tune with Nature
entries: At 1st level, you become proficient in the Nature skill, the Druidic language, and you learn the thorn whip cantrip if you do not already know it.
When you hit a creature with your thorn whip, you can elect to reduce its movement speed by half until the end of its next turn instead of pulling it toward you.

subclassFeature.name: Mother's Embrace
entries: At 1st level, you can call your patron to embrace and restore you. As a reaction to taking damage, you can sink into the ground so that you are fully submerged. While underground, you have total cover and are blinded, deafened, and can't breathe. At the start of your next turn, you regain hit points equal to 1d8 + your warlock level, and reappear in the space you previously occupied. If that space isn't empty, you appear in the closest empty space.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Nature's Ward
entries: Starting at 6th level, your patron gives you the ability to command the environment around you, allowing you to harness it for your allies' protection. As a reaction to an ally within 30 feet of you that you can see being targeted by an attack or effect causing it to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can summon wood, bramble and plants from the earth to momentarily protect them, granting them half cover from the effect, then crumbling back to nothing. You can make this reaction after the ally has been targeted but before the attack roll or saving throw is made.

subclassFeature.name: Sympathetic Photosynthetic
entries: Starting at 10th level, if you spend at least 1 hour in the sunlight, have access to potable water and your skin has touched fertile soil in the past 24 hours, you do not need to eat to survive. Additionally, you become proficient in Constitution saving throws and gain resistance to poison.

subclassFeature.name: Wrath of the Ancients
entries: Starting at 14th level, you can use your bonus action to become assume your true form as a nature spirit for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain the effects of both the enlarge/reduce and barkskin spells, without the need to concentrate on either one.

The first time you take fatal damage for the duration of this feature, the effects of Mother's Embrace immediately trigger. Instead of the normal value, you regain hit points equal to half your maximum hit points.
When you hit a creature with your thorn whip, you can expend a warlock spell slot to deal 6d8 additional acid damage to the target.

When you hit a creature with your thorn whip, you can use your bonus action to entangle the target. The creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw, becoming restrained on a failure. A restrained creature can repeat the save using its action, being freed on a success. You can restrain multiple creatures at once in this manner, up to an amount equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hedge Magic
entries: While almost all wizards study in formal schools, or under the tutelage of a wise master, some wizards reject traditional arcane schooling and strike out into the world to learn by doing. These rare few who hone their craft out in the wilds are referred to as hedge wizards. Though their methods are frowned upon by formal wizard schools, any archmage worthy of his station will reluctantly recognize that hedge wizards are the true masters of low level magic.

subclassFeature.name: Cantrip Savant
entries: When you adopt this tradition at 2nd level, your unorthodox relationship with arcane magic allows you to you learn fundamental magic not traditionally associated with wizards. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the spell list of any class. It counts as a wizard spell for you, but does not count against your total number of Cantrips Known.
You learn an additional cantrip of your choice from any spell list when you reach 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Self-Taught
entries: Starting at 2nd level, your passing familiarity with all schools of magic, and your unique spellbook shorthand allow you to copy spells into your spellbook at a discount. The time you must spend to copy any spell into your spellbook is halved, and the cost of the materials is reduced by 50 gold.

subclassFeature.name: On the Fly
entries: At 6th level, your skill with basic magic is second to none, and you have gained the ability to spontaneously cast spells that you haven't prepared. As an action, you can cast any spell from your spellbook of 2nd-level or lower, even if you did not have that spell prepared, expending a spell slot as normal. The spell must have a casting time of one action.
You may use this ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
You can use this ability to cast higher level spells when you reach certain levels in this class: 3rd-level spells at 10th level, 4th-level spells at 14th level, and 5th-level spells at 18th level.

subclassFeature.name: Hardy Magic
entries: At 10th level, learning your magic out in the wild, instead of the controlled environment of a formal school, has made you hardier than most wizards. When you are forced to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on a spell, you can use your reaction to add your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1) to the result of the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Conservation
entries: Starting at 14th level, your deep understanding of fundamentals of low-level magic allows you to recycle arcane energy from failed spells. When you cast a spell of 4th-level or lower and the spell misses it's target or fails, you regain one of your expended spell slots. The spell slot you regain must be of a level lower than the spell slot used to cast the initial spell. This effect applies to all spells of 4th-level or lower, even if they are cast with a higher level spell slot.
When you reach 18th level in this class, this feature effects any spells of 5th-level or lower.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Arcana
entries: Some schools of arcane thinking focus on training wizards for war, while others train wizards to embrace a particular school of magic. Other wizards' schools elect to teach wizards to use their time and magic to turn their bodies into weapons.

Some wizards choose to adapt their extensive education to specialize in alternative uses of Transmutation, Evocation and Abjuration magics, combining them with their physical prowess to further strengthen themselves, with a nearly monastic dedication.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Martial Training
entries: When you adopt this tradition at 2nd level, you use a constant magic to shield your body. While you do not wear armor or use a shield, your AC becomes 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier. If you are incapacitated or if you are within an antimagic field, this effect is suspended.

Additionally, your fists count as a martial melee weapon worth 1gp for determining the material components of spells that require a weapon, and you can make an unarmed strike if a spell would require you to make an attack with a melee weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Unarmed Strikes
entries: Also at 2nd level, you can use your magic to guide and strengthen your attacks. You can choose to use Intelligence for attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes. When you do so, the damage die becomes a d4, and the attack deals force damage. If you take the Attack action on your turn and make an unarmed strike, you can use a bonus action to make another.

The damage for your arcane unarmed strikes increases when you reach higher wizard levels. At 5th level, the damage of the attack increases by 1d4 (2d4), and again at 11th level (3d4) and 17th level (4d4).

subclassFeature.name: Infused Strikes
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can imbue your fists with one wizard spell that you can cast, then make a single unarmed strike. If the attack hits, the spell attack roll for the imbued spell, or the first one if there are several (subsequent ranged spell attacks are not made at disadvantage), hits the target automatically and is considered to be part of the unarmed attack. The target suffers the attack's normal effects, and is subject to the effects of the spell, expending a spell slot accordingly. If the attack has advantage, the target's initial saving throw against the spell, if there is one, has disadvantage. If the attack misses, the spell has no effect but the spell slot is expended. Area of effect spells originate from the target's space.

The spell you cast with this feature must have a casting time of 1 action, or require an action to activate if you are already concentrating on it (such as witch bolt), have a range other than self, and be cast using a spell slot between 1st- and 5th-level. Once you use this feature, you cannot use it again until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Deflect Arcana
entries: When you reach 10th level, you know how to ward yourself against hostile spells. When you are hit with a spell attack roll, you can use your reaction to reduce the damage by 1d10 + your Intelligence modifier + your Wizard level. If you reduce the damage to 0, you can expend a spell slot of equal level (unless the spell was a cantrip) to cast the spell yourself.

Alternatively, if you reduce a spell's damage to 0 in this way, you can choose to regain a spell slot equal to the level of the spell you use this feature on. If the spell is of 6th level or higher, you only regain a 5th-level spell slot. You can only absorb a spell in this way once, regaining the ability to do so when you complete a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Ideal Technique
entries: By 14th level, you know how to exceed your limits when you need to. When you use your action to cast a spell, or to use your Infused Strikes feature, you can use a bonus action to make an unarmed strike.

Additionally, when you use your action to cast a spell of 1st- level or higher, you can use your bonus action to make a number of unarmed strikes equal to the half the level of the spell (rounded up). You can do this once, and regain the ability to do so when you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: School of Chromatics
entries: Chromatic wizards see the world as their ever-changing color palette. Emotions are just manifestations of a creature's soul changing color and portals to other dimensions are just the smears between two paintings to them. They yearn to study our world through the color spectrum, using a special school of the arcane known only to them: Chromatomancy.
Some chromatics grow to be world renowned artists who cherish in their success, but some turn to mischief, becoming tricksters who mess with the emotions and feelings of others.

subclassFeature.name: Lore of Colors
entries: When you adopt this tradition at 2nd level, when you reach certain levels in the class, your experiments with the chromatic side of the arcane help you understand your spells better.

When you find a spell that deals cold, fire, lightning or poison damage, those spells count as spells from the school of Chromatomancy. You may write down your Chromatomancy spells into your spellbook taking half the material cost as it normally would. These spells count as wizard spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Marvelous Paintbrush
entries: Additionally, at 2nd level you conjure a magical paintbrush that helps you shape the world as you please.

You gain the ability to transform any object's color and pattern as you wish. For each 10 minutes you spend shifting its coloration, you can transform up to 1 square foot of material. Your handiwork slowly fades on non-living material after a day and on living material after an hour has passed.
A creature can ascertain that the target has been altered with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your Spell Save DC.
Additionally, you may use this brush to copy Chromatomancy spells into your spellbook, thus taking only 10 minutes to copy each.
You may use this paintbrush as your spellcasting focus.

subclassFeature.name: Artist at work
entries: Your DM may rule that you need to succeed on a Charisma (Performance) check with a varying DC to complete your arcane work. While painting your party member pink may not require a skill check, camouflaging one might cause more of a a challenge.

If you are just painting a pretty picture on the city wall, that may not require a check, but if you are trying to hide the entrance of a cave your party is staying in, you are more likely to be asked for a check.

subclassFeature.name: Pigment of Gebleoth
entries: At 6th level, you discover that you can transform the arcane based on its colors. With this knowledge you can alter the color of your spells, thus changing their element.
When you cast a Chromatomancy spell with a spell slot you can substitute the damage type with one other from the list of damage types detailed in Lore of Colors.
You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Rainbow
entries: By 10th level your eyes become imbued with the magic of the color spectrum. You take in the colors of everything around you, even in pitch black conditions.
You gain a special kind of darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. When in dim light you see everything in its original color, and in darkness you see everything in muted, grayish tone.
If you already have darkvision from your race, its range increases by 30 feet and gains the effect mentioned above.

subclassFeature.name: Syphon Chroma
entries: At 10th level, you can syphon the color out of an area to fuel your arcane powers.

As an action on your turn you can drain the color out of a 15-foot cone in front of you. All nonmagical objects in the area are drained of their color becoming monochromatic or shades of grey. Enemies in the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded. A blinded creature can repeat the save at the end of each of their turns.
You regain spell slots of a combined level equal to the number of creatures that failed the save.

subclassFeature.name: Gaudy Explosion
entries: When you reach 14th level, you master the elements of color.

As an action on your turn, you can force the color out of your physical form, creating a brilliant explosion of chromatic effects. Roll {@dice 1d6} times on the Chromatic Spectrum table shown below, rerolling any duplicates. All enemies within a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on you, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, each creature takes full damage or half as much on a successful one.

Additionally, you may spend one use of Pigment of Gebleoth to Saturate one of the unleashed colors, giving it an extra effect. Enemies who succeed on the initial saving throw are not affected by the Saturated effect of the explosion. You must declare which explosion you want to Saturate before rolling for the color.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

entries.caption: Chromatic Spectrum
rows: You release the wrath of the color red. Every enemy in range is scorched by flames, suffering 2d6 fire damage.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: Burned enemies have disadvantage on their Constitution saving throws until the end of their next turn.

rows: You unleash the freezing power of the color white. Every enemy in range is engulfed in frost crystals, suffering 2d6 cold damage.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: Every enemy's legs freeze, taking a 15 feet reduction to their speed until the end of their next turn.

rows: You let loose a wave of toxic energy with the help of the color green. The veins of every enemy in range are filled with toxins, suffering 2d6 poison damage.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: The poison seeps into affected enemies, making them poisoned until the end of their next turn.

rows: You discharge a voltaic wave of blue color. Every enemy in range is electrocuted, suffering 2d6 lightning damage.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: Foes hit by the lightning damage are electrocuted, stunning them until the end of their next turn.

rows: You unchain the grim energy of the color black. Every enemy in range is stripped of a part of their life essence, suffering 2d6 necrotic damage.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: Enemies feel immense pain, gaining disadvantage on any Dexterity saving throws until the end of their next turn.

rows: You set free a divine flash of yellow color. Every enemy in range is enveloped in holy light, suffering 2d6 radiant damage.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: Allies that the wizard can see within 60 feet gain temporary hit points equal to the radiant damage dealt by this feature.

rows: You emit an acidic wave of orange color. Every enemy in range is hit by acrid rays, suffering 2d6 acid damage.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: The acid eats through the enemies' armor, reducing their AC by 2 until the end of their next turn.

rows: The chromatic explosion's effect echoes through to your next use of the arcane. You gain an extra use of Pigment of Gebleoth that you must use within the next minute.

rows.name: Saturated.
entries: Chromatic power envelops you, gaining resistance to all damage until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: School of Herbology
entries: The School of Herbology specializes in the conjuration, transformation, and cultivation of plants and fungi, especially those of a magical variety. While you harbor no special connection to the natural world, as a member of this school, you study to unlock the secrets of its magic. Through experimentation and exposure, you learn to control plant life, brew herbal medicines, and even create dangerous floral creatures to attack your enemies.

In many ways the wizarding equivalent to botany, this arcane tradition is by far the most practically demanding of its kind. Indeed, to encounter a diverse range of plant life, many of its followers double as explorers, apothecaries, gardeners, farmers, or educators seeking specimens from forests, tundras, swamps, and deserts.

The resurfacing interest in exploring the Witchingwood urged many herbologists to pack up, leave their homes and go out to explore the magical bramble and its vast number of plants and fungi. Some speak of a colorful and chaotic land beyond the woods that could be home to the most magical fauna mankind has ever seen.

subclassFeature.name: Herbology Savant
entries: When you adopt this tradition at 2nd level, you gain proficiency in the Nature skill and with a Herbalism Kit.
In addition, the entangle, locate animals or plants, plant growth, and awaken spells are added to your spellbook.

subclassFeature.name: Magic Mushrooms
entries: Also at 2nd level, you learn how to weave magic that can grow a troop of tiny mushrooms. Using an action, you can cause magical fungi to sprout in a 5-foot patch on a surface within 30 feet of you that you can see. The fungi can have one of four properties:

items: The fungi are sensitive to the movements of strangers. If a creature comes within 10 feet of the patch, the fungi continuously emit a piercing squeal until the creature moves out of range. This noise is audible within a 150-foot radius, and wakes up any sleeping creatures in this area. You may choose any amount of creatures to be excluded from this effect.
The fungi intoxicate others. Creatures within 10 feet of the patch have disadvantage on their saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

The fungi are covered in luminescent spores. The patch emits bright light in a 10-foot radius. In addition, creatures that move across the patch will be outlined in a bright light that illuminates a 5-foot radius until the end of their next turn.
The fungi emit spores that aid allies. If a creature of your choice moves within 10 feet of the patch, the fungi emit a cloud of spores that cure the poisoned condition on the creature.

entries: The fungi wilt after 1 hour, if they are damaged by fire, or if you use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Tangletrap
entries: At 6th level, you can conjure a mass of strangling plants to trap those around you. Whenever a creature moves within 20 feet of you, you can use your reaction to force all creatures other than you in a 20-foot radius around you to make a Strength saving throw.

Targets that fail this save are seized by thick vines, weeds or roots, becoming restrained and unable to breathe or speak until the end of your next turn. A restrained creature can repeat this saving throw as an action, freeing itself on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Exposure Therapy
entries: By 10th level, your study of the plant world has inured you to many of its hazards. You gain resistance to poison damage, and you have advantage on your saving throws against being poisoned. In addition, you are no longer slowed or damaged by plant-based difficult terrain, and you have advantage on your saving throws against spells which involve creating plants, such as the entangle spell.

subclassFeature.name: Growth
entries: After reaching 14th level, the wrath of nature spell is added to your spellbook if it wasn't already. You may cast this spell once without expending a spell slot. When you cast the spell in this way you also conjure a plant monstrosity called the {@creature Surculus|Hergard}. The surculus cannot leave the area created by wrath of nature and it disappears when the spell ends.

The surculus shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It can move and use its reaction on its own, but the only action it takes on its turn is the Dodge action, unless you take a bonus action on your turn to command it to take another action. That action can be one in its stat block or some other action. If you are incapacitated, the defender can take any action of its choice, not just Dodge.
Once you cast the spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the surculus hides its stinger and stays motionless, it is indistinguishable from a large, decorative plant.

trait.name: Venomous
entries: The surculus's attacks ignore resistance to poison damage, and treat immunity to poison damage as resistance to poison damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The surculus makes two sting attacks.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d12 }) poison damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. If the creature fails its saving throw by 5 or more, it is {@condition stunned} instead. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the poison and stun on itself on a success.

table.name: Fate Cards
table.caption: Fate Cards
rows: You roll twice on this table, and use both effects in the order you rolled them.
You automatically succeed on the next saving throw you make.
All creatures within 30 feet of you are deafened for 1 minute.
All creatures within 30 feet of you become frightened of you until the start of your next turn.
The properties of all magic items within 60 feet of you are suppressed for 1 minute.
You cast telepathy, targeting a friendly creature you can see within 30 feet of you.
Your next concentration spell you cast doesn't require concentration and lasts its full duration.
Your Strength score is reduced to 1 for 1 hour.
You are proficient in all saving throws until you move 5 feet or more.
Your box of cards is teleported to a random unoccupied space within 30 feet of you.
The next time you hit a creature with an attack, you and the target take 4d4 radiant damage.
All creatures within 10 feet of you take fire damage equal to half your current hit points.
You cast feign death on yourself.
You can't have advantage or disadvantage on any attack rolls for 1 minute.
You are surrounded by a halo of flies until you take the Help action.
A random creature within 60 feet of you is struck by lightning, taking 6d6 lightning damage.
You regain one expended warlock spell slot.
All creatures within 120 feet of you fall unconscious until the start of your next turn.
All creatures within 1 mile of you regain 1 hit point.
You take 1d4 psychic damage whenever you knowingly lie within the next 24 hours.
All of your ability scores are equal to your level for the next minute.
You have advantage on all ability checks for 1 minute.
You learn the guidance cantrip. It doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.
You can take the Use an Object action as a bonus action until you take the Cast a Spell action.
You learn the rope trick spell. The spell doesn't count against your number of spells know.
You can't take the Attack action until you finish a short or long rest.
You are immune to fire damage for 1 minute.
You don't provoke opportunity attacks until the end of your next turn.
You cast death ward on yourself.
You spend your action on your next turn crying.
You ignore difficult terrain until you finish a short or long rest.
You have advantage on your next initiative roll.
You are immune to being frightened until you finish a short or long rest.
All creatures within 30 feet of you have advantage on the next ability check they make.
You gain immunity to piercing damage until you take slashing damage.
You can take the Help action as a bonus action until you take the Attack action.
You don't require food or water for 20 days.
You regain all of your spent Hit Die.
You cast life transference, targeting a random creature within 30 feet of you.
The next time you make an attack roll with advantage, you treat both d20 rolls as a 1.
If you have inspiration, you lose it. If you don't, you gain inspiration.
You cast goodberry, creating ten times the normal amount of berries.
You are proficient with medium armor and martial weapons for 24 hours.
You gain a flying speed of 300 feet until the end of your turn.
You gain proficiency in all skills for 1 hour.
You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage and vulnerability to piercing damage for 24 hours.
You gain proficiency in the Religion skill if you don't already have it.
You cast warding bond on a random friendly creature. The spell's range is increased to 300 feet.
You become invisible until the end of your next turn.
You take necrotic damage equal to 1d8 × your current number of Hit Dice.
You gain temporary hit points equal to your hit point maximum that last for 1 minute.
You cast daylight, targeting your box of cards.
Your eyes turn black for 7 days.
You are under the effect of a gentle response spell for 1 year.
Your hair turns golden for 24 hours.
You are immune to falling damage until you finish a long rest.
You are charmed by every creature you can see until you take damage.
You can breathe underwater for 7 days.
Whenever you make an attack roll within the next minute, you treat the d20 roll as a 10.
You are blinded until you are reduced to 0 hit points.
You can speak Celestial and Abyssal for the next 48 hours.
Whenever you speak within the next minute, any glass surface within 30 feet of you shatters.
You cast greater restoration on yourself.
The next time you make an ability check with disadvantage, you treat both d20 rolls as a 20.
You are immune to being charmed until you have moved 500 feet.
You have advantage on all Charisma (Deception) checks until you deal damage to a creature.
You cast sequester on yourself. The spell lasts until a creature says your name out loud.
The sound of an explosion, audible from as far away as 1 mile, emanates from your mouth.
You have disadvantage on all saving throws for 1 minute.
For 1 minute, you can cast passwall without expending a spell slot or material components.
You suffer one level of exhaustion.
You have truesight until the end of your turn.
Your Intelligence score is increased by 1d10 for 24 hours.

entries.name: Ammunition
entries: All firearms require ammunition to make an attack, and due to their rare nature, ammunition may be near impossible to find or purchase. However, if materials are gathered, you can craft ammunition yourself using your Tinker's Tools at half the cost. Each firearm uses its own unique ammunition and is generally sold or crafted in batches listed below next to the price.

entries.name: Reload
entries: The weapon can be fired a number of times equal to its Reload score before you must spend 1 attack or 1 action to reload. You must have one free hand to reload a firearm.

entries.name: Misfire
entries: Whenever you make an attack roll with a firearm, and the dice roll is equal to or lower than the weapon's Misfire score, the weapon misfires. The attack misses, and the weapon cannot be used again until you spend an action to try and repair it. To repair your firearm, you must make a successful Tinker's Tools check (DC equal to 8 + misfire score). If your check fails, the weapon is broken and must be mended out of combat at a quarter of the cost of the firearm. Creatures who use a firearm without being proficient increase the weapon's misfire score by 1.

entries.name: Explosive
entries: Upon a hit, everything within 5 ft of the target must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier) or suffer 1d8 fire damage. If the weapon misses, the ammunition fails to detonate, or bounces away harmlessly before doing so.
